column2: Hold any 2 of the Reachmen Kingdoms (Bleakwind, Eastreach, Karthspire, Markarth, Ravenhall).

Sometimes sacrifices must be made in the pursuit of a worthy goal, and there are more important things to consider than the opinions of those without the conviction to make the sacrifices. Let them hate me, so long as they obey me.
I have become a tyrant.
Today I reflected on what future generations would think of my actions. Do the ends really justify the means? Perhaps I have a duty to use my power responsibly?
I am no longer a tyrant.
Corrupted (Atomos Corruption)
Devastated (Atomos Corruption)
Must belong to a religion with patron deities.
Form a Confederacy
Change your government to a Confederacy, giving greater autonomy to the lesser lords.
Abandon Leader Trait
Abandon your military expertise trait in the hope of achieving a new one.
Stop Conversion
Stop all attempts to subtle convert this provinces to your culture and religion.
Requisitioned Fishing Ships
Requisition Fishing Ships
Requisition Fishing Ships
We are at war, it's only fair that we may order the local fishers to lend their boats to our army.
Has not recently requisitioned fishing ships.
Successfully steal an artifact.
Wasteland (Atomos Corruption)

Those who survived but bore witness to the Pankratosword will yet suffer, either robbed of their sight by its brilliance or burned by its scorching touch and even those that hid from it may yet fall victim to a mysterious sickness.\nThe land too will suffer for a time as the corruption wrought by the stonemagick seaps into the bedrock, though it will with time eventually recover.

Those who survived but bore witness to the Pankratosword will yet suffer, either robbed of their sight by its brilliance or burned by its scorching touch and even those that hid from it may yet fall victim to a mysterious sickness.\nThe land too will suffer for generations as the corruption wrought by the stonemagick seaps into the bedrock, though it will one day in the far future recover.

If any survived the horrific power of the Pankratosword, they will yet suffer for their impudence. If they bore witness to its brilliance they will find themselves robbed of their sight, if they felt the edge of its searing embrace they will find their skin burned and bubbled, and even those shielded from the Pankratosword may yet suffer from a mysterious illness.\nThe sheer awesome power unleashed however will have far worse effects upon the land, anything that once grew here will wither and die, the animals will flee and nothing will ever return lest it wish to taste the metallic embrace of the lingering stonemagick.
I could have sworn I left my spectacles around here somewhere. Wait, what's that on my head? Ah, here they are.
I have become absent minded.

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [Root.GetBestName] has unmade the rules of nature. Those within the blast of energy will have neither felt nor seen the terrifying power as their flesh and bones were vaporised instantaneously, along with everything and everyone else in the province including [Root.GetBestName]. While nowhere near as powerful as the combined Hirdirge Pankratosword that sank Yokuda, the power unleashed here has been truely devastating, scarring the landscape forever and corrupting even neighbouring provinces, an eerie silence now lays across the affected land, all manner of beasts and insects having died or fled. Those few individuals who have managed to survive the annihilation can scarcely be called lucky, for none escaped entirely unscathed. Those not blinded by the flash will suffer from pains and sickness for the remainder of their lives, a sickness not even the most powerful of Magicks can cure.

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [Root.GetBestName] has unleashed a devastating magickal force. A brilliant flash, flames and immense heat hotter than any fire magicks has engulfed a large swathe of this region, annihilating armies, innocents and cities alike, turning all to dust. [Root.HirdirgeStatusAfterNuke].

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [Root.GetBestName] has unleashed a scorching magickal force. A brilliant flash, flames and immense heat hotter than any fire magicks has engulfed part of this region, vaporising armies and turning to dust any unfortunate enough to be caught within the blast. [Root.HirdirgeStatusAfterNuke].

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [Root.GetBestName] has unleashed a terrifying magickal force. In an instantaneous flash of white-heat, the Armies surrounding the Ansei have been indiscriminately vaporised. Any not caught by the blast but witness to its brilliance have been touched by the scorch, either robbed of their sight or horrifically burned. [Root.HirdirgeStatusAfterNuke].

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [Root.GetBestName] has unleashed a terrifying magickal force. Masterfully executing the Pankratosword, [Root.GetBestName] directed the blast at the enemy, vaporising them. All but a few stragglers survive and even those will be taken by a sickness or the burns they have suffered. Collateral damage to the land and [Root.GetBestName]'s own forces was minimal. [Root.GetBestName] too survived their own fearsome powers thanks to their masterful technique.

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [Root.GetBestName] has destroyed themselves in a spectacular fashion. The energy they attempted to unleash backfired, their body and those immediately around them vaporising in a brilliant white-hot flash. All that remains is a large scorched crater, a permanent monument to [Root.GetBestName]'s suicidal sacrifice. Nothing grows within the crater, that small piece of land forever corrupted.
Unleashing the Pankratosword

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [From.GetBestName] has unmade the rules of nature. Those within the blast of energy will have neither felt nor seen the terrifying power as their flesh and bones were vaporised instantaneously, along with everything and everyone else in the province including [From.GetBestName]. While nowhere near as powerful as the combined Hirdirge Pankratosword that sank Yokuda, the power unleashed here has been truely devastating, scarring the landscape forever and corrupting even neighbouring provinces, an eerie silence now lays across the affected land, all manner of beasts and insects having died or fled. Those few individuals who have managed to survive the annihilation can scarcely be called lucky, for none escaped entirely unscathed. Fortunately you have managed to survive the horrific event physically uninjured, at least outwardly. Though you still have sight and your skin is unblistered, you feel a strange tingling upon your skin and a faint nausea rising in your gut.

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [From.GetBestName] has unleashed a devastating magickal force. A brilliant flash, flames and immense heat hotter than any fire magicks has engulfed a large swathe of this region, annihilating armies, innocents and cities alike, turning all to dust. Those not in the immediate blast but witness to the devastation have been blinded, burned or worse and even those in neighbouring lands will feel the effects of the Pankratosword in the days and weeks to come. Fortunately you have managed to survive the horrific event physically uninjured, at least outwardly. Though you still have sight and your skin is unblistered, you feel a strange tingling upon your skin and a faint nausea rising in your gut.

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [From.GetBestName] has unleashed a scorching magickal force. A brilliant flash, flames and immense heat hotter than any fire magicks has engulfed part of this region, vaporising armies and turning to dust any unfortunate enough to be caught within the blast. Those not in the immediate blast but witness to the devastation have been blinded, burned or worse and fallout from the magickal energies has seeped into the land, corrupting it for generations. Fortunately you have managed to survive the horrific event physically uninjured, at least outwardly. Though you still have sight and your skin is unblistered, you feel a strange tingling upon your skin and a faint nausea rising in your gut.

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [From.GetBestName] has unleashed a brilliant, terrifying magickal force. In an instantaneous flash of white and heat, the Armies surrounding the Ansei have been indiscriminately vaporised into nothingness. Any not caught within the detonation but witness to its brilliance have been touched by the scorch, their eyes dulled by the white light and their skinned blistered. A sickness will spread amongst survivors within the province in the coming weeks, though the land itself and those hardy enough will survive. Fortunately you weren't within range of the most devastating effects of the Pankratosword although you feel a faint strange tingling feeling upon your skin. Perhaps it's just nerves.

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [From.GetBestName] has unleashed upon their enemies a terrifying magickal force. Masterfully executing the forbidden techniques, [From.GetBestName] directed their Pankratosword at the enemy army, vaporising it instantaneously. All but a few stragglers managed to survive and even those in the coming days will be taken by a sickness or the burns they have suffered. Collateral damage to the land and [Root.GetBestName]'s own forces was minimal, and the scorched landscape will recover with the seasons. [Root.GetBestName] too survived their own fearsome powers thanks to their masterful technique. Fortunately you also survived, having been nowhere near the dangerous Pankratosword when it was unleashed.

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [From.GetBestName] has destroyed themselves in a spectacular fashion. The energy they attempted to unleash backfired, their body and those immediately around them vaporising in a brilliant white-hot flash. All that remains is a large scorched crater, a permanent monument to [From.GetBestName]'s suicidal sacrifice. Nothing grows within the crater, that small piece of land forever corrupted. Fortunately you were nowhere near [From.GetBestName] when they vaporised themselves, though you're sure it was spectacular to behold.
I hope never to witness something so destructive ever again!
I don't feel so good.
Unleash the Pankratosword
Use your Pankratosword technique to cleave the atomos and annihilate your enemies.
What a fool, better they fall today than attempt that again!

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [From.GetBestName] has unmade the rules of nature. Those within the blast of energy will have neither felt nor seen the terrifying power as their flesh and bones were vaporised instantaneously, along with everything and everyone else in the province including [From.GetBestName]. While nowhere near as powerful as the combined Hirdirge Pankratosword that sank Yokuda, the power unleashed here has been truely devastating, scarring the landscape forever and corrupting even neighbouring provinces, an eerie silence now lays across the affected land, all manner of beasts and insects having died or fled. Those few individuals who have managed to survive the annihilation can scarcely be called lucky, for none escaped entirely unscathed. Unfortunately you were unable to look away in time and your eyes bore full witness to the pure brutality that was unleashed.

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [From.GetBestName] has unleashed a devastating magickal force. A brilliant flash, flames and immense heat hotter than any fire magicks has engulfed a large swathe of this region, annihilating armies, innocents and cities alike, turning all to dust. Those not in the immediate blast but witness to the devastation have been blinded, burned or worse and even those in neighbouring lands will feel the effects of the Pankratosword in the days and weeks to come. Unfortunately you were unable to look away in time and your eyes bore full witness to the pure brutality that was unleashed.

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [From.GetBestName] has destroyed themselves in a spectacular fashion. The energy they attempted to unleash backfired, their body and those immediately around them vaporising in a brilliant white-hot flash. All that remains is a large scorched crater, a permanent monument to [From.GetBestName]'s suicidal sacrifice. Nothing grows within the crater, that small piece of land forever corrupted. Unfortunately you were unable to look away in time and your eyes bore full witness to the pure brutality that was unleashed.
I hope never to witness something so destructive ever again!
The illness spread to you by witnessing and surviving the Pankratosword is progressing rapidly. At first you felt nauseous, now you are overcome with a burning fever and uncontrollable diarrhea.
What's happening to me?

First was the vomiting, then the fever and the diarrhea. Now your head feels like it's going to explode, splotchy purple patches have appeared all over your body and you are unable to drag yourself from bed for a chronic lack of energy.
I feel as if I am dying a slow, painful death.

Your illness has progressed yet further, your purpled skin blistering and oozing puss. All energy you once may have had has been sapped fighting this sickness and you lay in your filthy bed virtually catatonic. The Physicians, Mages and Mystics your Council have conferred with are unable to treat the conditions and attribute your ailments to the corruption of the Pankratosword.
I survived the fire and yet it will still claim me...

You have succumbed to the so-called Pankratosickness, the lingering corruption of that terrible technique you bore witness to. Though you survived it, some would say a better fate would have been to embrace it. At least now you are free of the pain and suffering.
My suffering is ended, at last.

The sickness with which you were afflicted is dissapating as quickly as it took hold and you feel yourself growing stronger every day. Your Physicians proclaim it a miracle, for surely it must be as they had had been unable to cure it. Though the sickness itself is passing, you will bear the scars of it with you forever.
I don't feel so good.
The infections you suffered have left your skin physically scarred.
The infections you suffered have left you with a lingering decay.
The trauma to your mind and body has been immense and the illness has robbed you of a great deal of your mental faculties.
The trauma to your mind and body has been immense and the illness has robbed you of a great deal of your physical prowess.
Though recovered from the worst symptoms, you will likely be infirm for the remainder of your life.
Died in terrible pain and suffering from the mysterious Pankratosickness.
What a fool, better they fall today than attempt that again!

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [From.GetBestName] has unmade the rules of nature. Those within the blast of energy will have neither felt nor seen the terrifying power as their flesh and bones were vaporised instantaneously, along with everything and everyone else in the province including [From.GetBestName]. While nowhere near as powerful as the combined Hirdirge Pankratosword that sank Yokuda, the power unleashed here has been truely devastating, scarring the landscape forever and corrupting even neighbouring provinces, an eerie silence now lays across the affected land, all manner of beasts and insects having died or fled. Those few individuals who have managed to survive the annihilation can scarcely be called lucky, for none escaped entirely unscathed. In the last moments, before the flash, you were able to shield your eyes. Unfortunately, you were still too close to the blast radius and your skin burns, falling away from your body as medics try to calm your screams.

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [From.GetBestName] has unleashed a devastating magickal force. Collateral damage to the land and [Root.GetBestName]'s own forces was minimal, and the scorched landscape will recover with the seasons. [Root.GetBestName] too survived their own fearsome powers thanks to their masterful technique. In the last moments, before the flash, you were able to shield your eyes. Unfortunately, you were still too close to the blast radius and your skin burns, falling away from your body as medics try to calm your screams.

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [From.GetBestName] has destroyed themselves in a spectacular fashion. The energy they attempted to unleash backfired, their body and those immediately around them vaporising in a brilliant white-hot flash. All that remains is a large scorched crater, a permanent monument to [From.GetBestName]'s suicidal sacrifice. Nothing grows within the crater, that small piece of land forever corrupted. In the last moments, before the flash, you were able to shield your eyes. Unfortunately, you were still too close to the blast radius and your skin burns, falling away from your body as medics try to calm your screams.
The pain! I can't take it, please kill me!
In addition to your horrific disfigurement, the shear awesome power and your proximity to the blast has caused you to become sick with an unknown illness...\n
My eyes! They took my eyes!
In addition to your eyes being taken, the shear awesome power and your proximity to the blast has caused you to become sick with an unknown illness...\n
Now I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds.
A power as awesome as it is terrifying.
A necessary evil to achieve victory.
The death, the destruction. I am a god!
All of my enemies will fall.
I'd rather go out with a bang than witness my own defeat!
I am but dust in the wind.

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [From.GetBestName] has unmade the rules of nature. Those within the blast of energy will have neither felt nor seen the terrifying power as their flesh and bones were vaporised instantaneously, along with everything and everyone else in the province including [From.GetBestName]. Those few individuals who have managed to survive the annihilation can scarcely be called lucky, for none escaped entirely unscathed. Alas you are one of the victims of this horrific power, your body vaporised and your spirit cast to oblivion.

[Root.GetBestName] too survived their own fearsome powers thanks to their masterful technique but alas you are one of its many victims, your body vaporised and your spirit cast to oblivion.

Utilising the techniques of the Hirdirge, [From.GetBestName] has destroyed themselves in a spectacular fashion. The energy they attempted to unleash backfired, their body and those immediately around them vaporising in a brilliant white-hot flash. All that remains is a large scorched crater, a permanent monument to [From.GetBestName]'s suicidal sacrifice. Nothing grows within the crater, that small piece of land forever corrupted. Alas due to your proximity to [From.GetBestName] you have the unfortunate honour of accompanying them to the afterlife, your body vaporised along with theirs.
Died spectacularly to their own Pankratosword technique.
[This.GetBestName] survives unscathed.
[This.GetBestName] survives the blast but failed to turn from the blinding flash.
[This.GetBestName] survives the Pankratosword but is badly burned.
Died from the Pankratosword technique unleashed by $KILLER$.
[This.GetBestName] is claimed by the Pankratosword.
I have begun updating and checking my calendar at regular intervals and writing notes to remind me of what I should be doing.  I even remembered to attend the seminary on time!
I am no longer absent minded.
The effort of washing every day seems to be a waste of time. I just get dirty again. Maybe it would save time if I just washed once a week?
I have become a slob.

I noticed someone I was speaking with flinch and withdraw when I got too close. I heard them vomiting outside a few minutes later. I think my breath might be physically repulsing people! I vowed to scrub my mouth and body until I am completely clean.
I am no longer a slob.

I saw a pair of lovers beneath a tree today. They were wearing the most beautifully elegant clothes I have seen. The couple drew adoring gazes from all who passed by and I decided that I want to draw the same gazes when I appear in my finery.
I have become fashionable.

The bill of sale from my most recent shopping trip stunned me. I hadn't quite realised how much I was spending on my wardrobe. The court seems to be moving away from red silks and towards crushed velvet, but I think I will stick with silk for a while longer.
I am no longer fashionable.

I was trying to reach an apple on a tree outside the window but it was just beyond my grasp, so I stood on the windowsill to get closer. I lost my footing and tumbled into a passing cart filled with hay. That was quite fortunate, I suppose.
I have become reckless.
I was about to bet one of my favourite heirlooms on the outcome of a dice roll when I began having second thoughts. I realised that some things in life should be kept safe from the ravages of chance.
I am no longer reckless.

The meritocratic system in [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] has allowed me to fully demonstrate my ability to my liege, [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName], and I have made myself indispensable to [Root.Liege.GetHerHim] despite having no landed titles of my own. My rivals in court, many of them highborn nobles, are fuming!
I will turn my liege against them.

Despite having no holdings of [From.GetHerHis] own, my loyal councillor [From.GetTitledName] has demonstrated [From.GetHerHis] value to me time and again. My less favoured landed vassals and the stagnant, backwards realms around [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] look on in jealousy. The meritocratic system is working!
§RLost Respect (-10)§! between [Root.GetTitledName] and [From.GetTitledName]'s detractors.\n
Well done, [From.GetTitledName]!
A Pact is offered.
Abomination
an Abomination
This twisted disgusting creature is an abomination, likely some despicable trick of a Daedric Prince, or a perverted experiment by some decrepit mage.
Abundant Forests
A survey of this province has revealed our forests to be filled with to the brim with useful resources and supplies.
Accept.
Send your [GetLordSpiritualName] to advance the cultural technology of your demesne.
Enforce Martial Law
column3: Mater des révoltes
column4: Revolten unterdrücken
column6: Suprimir revueltas

column2: Cure Disease
Send your [GetLordSpiritualName] to bolster a province's defence against disease, or to cure an existing one.
Heal
Send your [GetLordSpiritualName] to a province to heal the wounded and cure the diseased.
Improve Magickal Relations
column3: Améliorer les relations religieuses
column4: Religiöse Beziehungen verbessern
column6: Mejorar relaciones religiosas

column2: Have your [GetLordSpiritualName] lead an academic delegation to discuss matters of magick with the local priests and wizards.
Rally Rebels
Send your [GetMarshalName] to another Lord's lands to rally the dissidents against them.
Proselytise
column3: Faire du prosélytisme
column4: Bekehren
column6: Hacer proselitismo

column2: Root out Cabals
Send your [GetSpymasterName] to root out dark cabals, necromancers and other evil groups from your provinces.
Sabotage Economy
Send your [GetSpymasterName] to sabotage your enemy's economy.
Sabotage Military
Send your [GetSpymasterName] to sabotage your enemy's military.
Sabotage Research
Send your [GetSpymasterName] to sabotage your enemy's research.
Slander
Use your [GetChancellorName] to tarnish another Lord's reputation.
Send your [GetTreasurerName] to ensure efficient taxation and logistical organisation in the county.
column3: Demandez à votre Intendant de percevoir suffisamment d’impôts dans le comté.
column4: Entsendet Euren Verwalter, um effiziente Besteuerung in der Grafschaft sicherzustellen.
column6: Envía a tu mayordomo para garantizar recaudación de impuestos eficaz en el condado.

column2: Send your [GetSpymasterName] to study the technological progress of other realms.
Survey Province
Send your [GetTreasurerName] on a mission to survey a province within your demesne.
Tend the Wounded
Send your [GetLordSpiritualName] to tend the wounded during war, increasing your army's morale.
You saved my life, now it is yours to guard from this day forth!
I could do with a new personal guard.
I could always use capable people - summon them to Court.
Become Friends
Become friends with this person.
Lord Admiral Appointed
Lord Admiral Appointed
Adopted

[Root.GetFirstName] has been adopted from an orphanage. Though they carry the dynastic name of their adoptive parent, they must live with the stigma of not being a true successor for the rest of their lives.
Adopt an Orphan
Adopt an Orphan from a local orphanage to continue your dynastic name after you have perished.
Adopt an Orphan Girl from a local orphanage to continue your dynastic name after you have perished.
Adopt an Orphan
Adopt an Orphan from the local orphanage to continue your dynasty after you perish.
Today was the most boring day of my life. I was called out of bed too early, then needed to sit with my boring guardian and after that, I needed to play with one of those annoying children.

I climbed up a nearby ruin. It was slippery, but I am very good at climbing, so I didn't fall. Once on the top, I saw a shiny artifact. I studied it for hours and it was already night when I went home.
I have to show this to my parents!
While I went home after a tiresome search, I saw something in the distance. It was [From.GetName], struggling to walk. Relieved, I picked [From.GetHerHim] up and took [From.GetHerHim] home.
Let's do something fun!
Let's call for the very best healers!
One of my servants reported that little [From.GetName] had gone missing.
Let's organise a search effort.
It's a waste of resources.
I have died.
That's sad.
I can always make more!
A farmer found [From.GetName]'s corpse. It was ravaged and blood was everywhere.
Arrange a proper burial.
I can always make more children like [From.GetHerHim].

Well, [From.GetHerHim] needed to learn about punishment eventually
I was sleeping when I heard someone yelling outside. I looked out of the window and saw my lost child. I called a servant and she let him in. He was carrying an interesting looking object.
Let the [GetLordSpiritualName] take a look at it.
Sell it.
[From.GetName] can keep it.
My parent has allowed me to keep the cool artifact I found. Yay!
Give it to the local museum.
Sell it.
That lady looks very beautiful. Maybe she would appreciate this 'gift'.
I need to be quick. This cave wasn't as safe as it looked from the outside. I quickly ran once I saw the monster. However, it was able to hit me and made a grotesque wound.
At least I live.
I was just done playing in the basement when the servant saw me. She looked very worried.
Grown-ups, they always worry!

Excellent!

As Emperor of Tamriel, your authority and might will allow you to become a Warlord and use the Warlord casus belli against the various provinces of Tamriel.\nWthe time is right you will also be able to launch an expedition eastward, to the lands of Mysterious Akavir...
An increasing amount of Eight Divines faithful are already saying that your feats are comparable to those of the other God of Men, or event greater.
A Courtier of some agency will appear at Court.
That was unexpected...
No one but the Gods, or the occasional lucky mage, lives forever. Not even a Mer like you.
Who am I to contradict the Gods?
The Gods, may they be Aedra or Daedra, have taken pity on you and put you out of your suffering.
Your illness demanded too much from your body.
Here is your money - now go get my amulet!
I don't need those people...
Ah well.

Alchemy is the art of distilling, deconstructing and recombining various ingredients and materials to unlock their inherent magickal properties in the form of potions that can be consumed when needed. [Root.GetName] has pursued this art as something of an almost obsessive interest.

One day I will unite this realm into a great High Kingdom, but first I must deal with the petty Kings that would seek to hinder me.

I have successfully located the forgotten tombs of the Reman Emperors. Within the tombs I can already hear the moans and tireless shuffling of the undead guardians no doubt placed to protect the dead Emperors, but the prize they protect, the Amulet of Kings is worth an Empire's worth of gold!

My liege, at your instruction I have been surveying the province of Sancre Tor and have discovered the ancient tombs of the Reman dynasty. My guards slew the guardians and we entered the tomb, retrieving for you the Amulet of Kings!
Your Steward has disappeared while surveying Sancre Tor, along with a dozen of his personal entourage. It is feared Bandits or worse have claimed their souls.

Eager to claim the Amulet of Kings, my guards and I charged into the Tombs. Many of my entourage were killed by the devious traps laid by the Tomb architects, the rest were cut down by the undead guardians. I alone was the last to survive, through all the traps and moaning undead I made it to the resting place of the amulet, but alas I am trapped here with my prize... I can already hear the undead gathering outside the doorway, clawing to get in...
Death
Reman Tombs Discovered!

After an arduous battle through the traps and undead guardians within the Reman Tombs, I have retrieved the Amulet of Kings for my liege. My guards are mostly dead or dying, but I, at least, have made it out alive.
Amulet of Kings Retrieved!
This is an auspicious day!
Amulet of Kings

The Amulet of Kings is a pendant traditionally worn by the ruling emperor of Cyrodiil. In the center of the amulet is the Chim-el Adabal, also known as the Red Diamond, a huge Soul Gem of Ayleid origin. It is held in a golden clasp surrounded by eight smaller gems that represent the Eight Divines of the original Cyrodiilic pantheon, created by Queen Alessia. It serves as the symbol of the divine right of the Tamrielic emperors, is an important component of the coronation ceremony. The soul of each reigning emperor is enshrined within the central stone, presumably during the coronation ritual involving the Dragonfires and the divine Covenant.
An ancient claim to a neighbouring piece of land once ruled by your distant ancestors has come to light.

This High King is an unstoppable force, and I must accept their rule.
I will not submit to this High King, my lands are my own.
This supposed High King is but a pretender, I am the true ruler of these marshes!

Other Petty Kings and rulers have acquiesced to this High King's demands of subservience, and while our stature affords us no responsibility to entertain the idea, there is a chance this ruler will look to claiming the title they believe rightly belongs to them.

The Cartographer rushes into your audience room after an absence of many months. Brushing aside the various documents upon your desk, he sets down a large rolled parchment and unrolls it, revealing an intricately drawn map with dragons and sea monsters popping from towers and lakes, gryphons flying over cities, snakes forming the roads and even people visible in city streets.

Atmoran Armour

This suit of ancient armour has been fashioned in the style of the ancient Nordic ancestors of Atmora. The original suit brought from Atmora consisted only of the polished plates, still hard as the day they were forged, though the cloth parts had long since turned to dust. It bears ancient symbols and runes across its blackened surface, and smiths say it is forged from an alloy of finest steel, and the mages say the runes are wardings of protection, written in the old script of the Atmorans.
Atmoran Greataxe

A large, jagged greataxe that once lay in the lands of Atmora but has been since retrieved by an intrepid explorer or adventurer. The Axe is made from some heavy but durable steel using lost smithing techniques, and somehow the steel never seems to warm up, always as cold to the touch as the land from whence it was pried. It would be wise to always wear gloves when handling it.
Atmoran Horn
A great Horn of some long forgotten breed of cattle, you think. The low, deep sound that emanates from the horn reverberates across your realm.
Atmoran Pantheon
The Atmoran Pantheon consists of the animist and draconic faiths that originated in Atmora.
Atmoran Shield
A hard and heavy rounded shield made of Atmoran wood, capped with steel. The millennia spent beneath ice and rock have petrified the wood, turning it hard as stone.
Colonise Atmora
Atmora, the frozen land in the north stands ripe for colonisation by a hardy people.

My enemies are all around me, everyone is out to claim what is mine! Even my body isn't sacred, with poisons and ills being poured into my food and drink, assassins lurking around every corner. I need a strong companion to protect me from my would-be murderers! I need a Bodyguard!

Your Master-at-Arms, while drilling your newly formed Knightly Order has discovered a man of great potential, skilled in personal combat and who professes an almost religious loyalty to you and your realm. Your Master-at-Arms suggests he may be a valuable asset as a personal guard to yourself.
After serving me loyally for a time, my Bodyguard has retired to a small farm in the country.

In the midsts of battle I was cornered by my enemy, but a brave soldier wielding nought but a broken sword and a shattered shield strode into the midsts of my would be killers, slaying them all. Once his deed was done, he pulled me from the mess of corpses and dragged me away from the centre of battle!

Cabals

My liege, I have discovered an abandoned Bandit Camp in [From.Location.GetName]. Within the camp was a decent sized cache of ill-gotten gains which I have claimed in your name. Regards, [From.GetTitledFirstName].

While surveying [From.Location.GetName] I have discovered a seemingly abandoned Bandit Camp. Wild animal tracks and the copious amounts of dried blood covering the tents and ground suggest a grim fate for the bandits that once dwell here, happily however wild animals weren't too interested in their haul.
Bandit Haul Discovered
I should inform my liege.
I should inform my liege, after taking a cut first.
Finders keepers, this coin could come in handy one day.

column2: Money in the Campaign Fund will increase your influence with the Religious Head and make your candidate more likely to be elected the next $RULER_TITLE$. You can freely adjust the amount until the next $RULER_TITLE$ is elected, when the Fund will be used up in the election campaign.
column3: L'argent de votre fonds de campagne sert à accroître votre influence auprès de la papauté et à augmenter les chances de votre candidat d'être élu $RULER_TITLE$. Vous pouvez ajuster librement ce montant jusqu'à l'élection du prochain $RULER_TITLE$, moment auquel votre fonds de campagne sera utilisé.
column4: Das Geld in der Wahlkampfkasse steigert Euren Einfluss beim Papst, sodass Euer Kandidat bessere Chancen auf die Wahl zum $RULER_TITLE$ hat. Ihr könnt den Betrag bis zum Zeitpunkt, an dem der $RULER_TITLE$ gewählt wird, frei verändern. Bei der Wahl wird der Betrag verbraucht.
column6: El dinero del Fondo para la campaña aumenta vuestra influencia con el Papa y aumenta las probabilidades de que vuestro candidato sea elegido el próximo $RULER_TITLE$. Podéis ajustar libremente la cantidad hasta que se elija al próximo $RULER_TITLE$, cuando se invertirá el Fondo en la campaña de electoral.

Your wife, in her loneliness and longing for a child has decided to purchase a cat from one of the scullery maids using money from your coffers.

Look what I found! Your child says one day, holding up a rather scruffy, mangy looking feline to your face, the smell of fish breath strong upon the air. Apparently while out wandering the estate's grounds, your young child has come across a stray cat. Can I keep it!? They ask excitedly.
After many years of loving companionship, my feline friend has departed this world.
My cat wandered off as usual several days ago, but has yet to return, its food going stale in its bowl. I fear the worst has befallen it.

The child was stillborn!
Stillborn!
The birth was a difficult one, and though the child was born, the mother did suffer greatly.
Difficult Birth
The birth was a difficult one, and though the midwives did try, the complications proved fatal for the mother. The babe shall now grow without knowing the woman who brought them into this world...
Difficult Birth
The birth was too much for me, and my soul has been claimed by Oblivion...
I will build the largest and most beautiful buildings when I grow up!
I have become Industrious!
I wear the most expensive clothes and smell like a rose
I have become Fashionable!
Jumping off the wall would be so fun!
I have become Reckless!
Why do clothes have to be coloured? They keep me warm even without colour!
I have become a Slob!
of the Chills

of Cholera
Cholera is one of the deadliest diseases in Tamriel, and is always fatal unless a cure is provided very quickly.
Chrondiasis
of Chrondiasis
Chrondiasis is a magickal disease which consumes the victim's intelligence and innate magicka day by day. Unless cured, this will eventually result in death.

While immersed deep in the Chronicle of your realm, you discover an anomaly in the family trees of some of your vassals. Upon further examination, and cross checking with older documents, you discover a vassal of yours may have a claim to one your titles!
This is most disconcerting, I should keep it to myself!
I should do the honourable thing and inform them.

Your liege, while perusing the realm's chronicle one night has discovered an old forgotten claim of your family to one of their titles. Rather than keep the discovery to themselves they have made the discovery public, to avoid potential scandal.

One night, while perusing the realm's chronicle, you discover that through some vague, long forgotten ties, you have a legitimate claim to one of your liege's titles. Upon exclaiming the discovery, one of your courtiers mentions overhearing your liege having a hushed conversation with one of their trusted sycophants concerning the very same claim.

Your Court Scribe, having been previously employed to write a Chronicle of the Realm and its inhabitants, has finally revealed their work. After many months, they have compiled a first edition, going into passing detail on the lesser families, and greater detail on the major families, including their rise and fall, and details of past and present rulers.
Your Court Scribe bows before you, and swiftly exits the audience chamber. It will be many months before the Chronicle of [Root.GetTitle] is completed.

Your liege has recently commissioned the creation of a Chronicle of the Dynasties and Lands of [From.GetTitle]. As a show of respect, your Liege has sent a copy of the Chronicle to every one of his vassals.

As I drank the sap and let the Hist flow into my mind, it was as if I could hear their singing in the depths of my soul. I felt at one with the Hist, Nirn and the Universe, and felt my spiritual connection strengthen with each moment.
It was wondrous.

As I drank the sap and let the Hist flow into my mind, it was as if I could hear their singing in the depths of my soul. I felt at one with the Hist, and with that oneness came perfect clarity, the Hist sharing their ancient secrets...
The Sap! It was too much!

As I drank the sap, it tasted sharp and bitter, somehow thicker than usual. I felt at first the familiar oneness but then, thoughts became darker, the sweet singing of the Hist grew deep and sinister, and all about me demons danced!
Commune with the Hist
Visit the local Hist Grove and drink from the holy sap.
Your court painter stands ready, scroll in hand, as they enquire of whom the portrait should be painted.
The artist goes on to enquire how they should paint the portrait...
Myself, of course.
My great father.
My dear mother.

Covens

Create Akavir Empire
Create the Akavir Empire and unite all the lands of Akavir. If you didn't conquer Tang Mo and Kingdom of Sun, this act will give the de jure to you to do so.
Form the Daggerfall Covenant

The Daggerfall Covenant is a defensive alliance primarily between the realms of High Rock and Hammerfell. It is formable during times of war, and guarantees mutual protection under a single, united realm.
Create the Ebonheart Pact
Form the Ebonheart Pact, a defensive alliance between Argonia, Morrowind and Skyrim.
Create the Aldmeri Dominion
Form the Aldmeri Dominion, and see the Mer regain their lost power as rulers of Tamriel.
Form Greater Argonia
We are strong, and now is the time to form our own Empire, let us create Greater Argonia!
Create the Bretonnic Empire
We have united the disparate Kingdoms of High Rock, and all those who dare to call themselves King or Queen in these fair lands will now bow before me or face the wrath of my armies!
Create the Cyrodillic Empire
Reform the Cyrodillic Empire and relive the glory days of Reman I!
Create the Daggerfall Covenant
Three races once at odds now stand united, let us form the Covenant and strengthen our ties!
Create the Velothi Empire
Let us form the Velothi Empire and regain the golden age of the Dunmer!
Create the Ebonheart Pact
Enemies grow envious of our power, and our people, once at odds, must unite against the world. Let us form the Pact and stay strong, together!
Create the Ta of the Two Moons
Create the Ta of the Two Moons for the glory of all Khajiit!
Form the Maormer Hegemony
It has been a long time coming, but now is the time for the rise of the Maormer Hegemony!
Create the Nordic Empire
Form the Nordic Empire and relive the glory days of the First Empire.
Establish the Potentate

I have secured the Imperial Isle and strengthened my position. While it is still tenuous, and it may cause controversy, I could force the Elder Council's to declare me the Imperial Potentate, perhaps with a view to establishing myself as the Emperor of Tamriel after some time has passed.
Take the throne of Tamriel!

I have ruled as the Potentate for a number of years now and have yet to be removed from my position. In fact, I feel my position has only grown stronger, and the Elder Council knows it. I have the force of will to have the Council declare me Emperor of all Tamriel, but do I have the force of arms to back it up?
Create the Empire of Tamriel
Create the glorious Empire of Tamriel and usher in the 3rd Era.
Create the Yokudan Empire
We, of the Redguard Peoples, have grown strong, where others have grown weak, and now is the time for us to form our own Empire!
Create the Empire of the Isles
Show the world that there are great powers outside of mainland Tamriel and Akavir.
Create the Empire of Jaegi
We have survived the monstrous hunger of the Tsaesci and taken back much of our homeland. Jaegi will stand in remembrance of the fallen!
Create the Vsai of Tsakara
The Tsaesci have completely supplanted the Akaviri and stand triumphant as the dominant race of Akavir, let Tsakara stand for a thousand generations!
Create the Kamal Empire
Let the world know the winter's winds fill only the sails of a united Kamal Empire!
Create Ka Po' Tun
The Po' Tun stand unconquered by the lesser races of Akavir. Let the Tiger-Dragon's Empire rise from their ashes!
Create Qing Mo
A thousand isles stand united under our banner. Let the Tang Mo stand victorious!
Create Alinor
Create Alinor
Reform Anequina
The Confederacy controls our lands no more, but our people need a strong Ta to rally behind. Shall we reform the Ta of Anequina?
Create Argonia
Create Argonia
Form the Kingdom of Bleakwind
As a free Reachmen who has carved himself a realm in my own home land, I will not suffer the yoke of another! I will forge my own Kingdom, and the Reach shall tremble to hear its name!
Create the Colovian Estates

We no longer strain under the yoke of these Nibenean dogs, or those so-called Imperials. The other Colovian lords are calling for a return to the rule of old, a return to the days of the Colovian Estates!
Unify the Kingdom of Cyrodiil

Form the Kingdom of Eastreach
As a free Reachmen who has carved himself a realm in my own home land, I will not suffer the yoke of another! I will forge my own Kingdom, and the Reach shall tremble to hear its name!

The Crown Levy law is the obligation of your vassals to provide men and arms to the crown during times of conflict. Vassals naturally enjoy laxity in this law, and become more unhappy as more of their own personal armies are called away to do their liege's bidding.

The Interregnum was a chaotic period, a time of warlords where simple commoners could rise up to lead an army to crush the old orders beneath their heels. One such warlord has arisen in [Root.Location.GetName]. He has rallied to himself a large host of elite fighting men, drawn from deserters and veterans of past wars.

Slaves in [Location.GetName] have taken up arms against their masters! Pushed too far by the heavy hand of their masters, they have murdered them in the night and armed themselves with farming implements, tools and weapons of the guards they overcame.
A horde of ne'er-do-wells have risen up in [Root.GetName], led by a charismatic Bandit. The bastards have the nerve to demand independence!
More rabble has flocked to the banners of the Warlord in [Root.GetName].
So long as there is an Empire, the Elder Council shall be its servant!
So long as there is an Empire, whether it be ruled by an Emperor, or a Potentate, the Elder Council shall be its servant!
So long as there is an Empire, the Elder Council shall be its servant!
There can be only one Empire of Tamriel, and the true Empire has an Emperor at its head! The Potentate is dissolved.
There can be only one Empire, and the Potentate of Tamriel takes precedence. The Empire of Cyrodiil will be dissolved.
There can be only one Empire in Cyrodiil, and the Empire of Tamriel takes precedence. The Empire of Cyrodiil will be dissolved.
The Elder Council has been dismissed, and my membership along with it. I no longer have the authority to carry the title.
As the High Chancellor of the Empire, I am bestowed with the leadership of the elite Elder Council and all the rights and responsibilities that go with it.
My request for a seat upon the Elder Council has been accepted!
My request for a seat upon the Elder Council has been refused!
The Emperor's Executioner comes at dawn!
An ambitious member of our dynasty is demanding we grant them a seat upon the Elder Council, our supreme legislative body. This will give them a vote in all decisions put before the Council.
The Emperor has seen fit to grant me a position upon the fabled Elder Council, the supreme legislative body of the Empire.
I accept this position, and the responsibilities and duties that come with it.
As a powerful landholder within the Empire, you are automatically guaranteed a place upon the Elder Council, the supreme legislative body of the Empire.
As a member of the Imperial Dynasty, I feel it is my right to hold a seat upon the Elder Council!
As a member of the Emperor's Small Council, it's only fitting that you are awarded a seat on the greater Elder Council.
The Emperor has revoked my appointed chair upon the Elder Council!
The Optimates were the aristocratic individuals who sought to limit the power of the Emperor in favour of the bereaucratic Elder Council, and by extension the Noble class itself.
The Imperialists were the so-called loyalists of the Elder Council who generally supported the decisions of the Emperor and voted in his favour.
The Nationalists were the dissidents of the Council who sought the dissolution or weakening of the Empire and its centralised authority.

At some point in their lives, each man, or woman, must ask themselves where their political alignment falls. Am I for the Empire, and the Emperor (Imperialist)? \nAm I for the Empire, but for the people (Optimate)? \nOr am I against the Empire, and seeking home rule for myself and my people (Nationalist)?
Elder Councillor
This individual is a member of the Elder Council, the supreme legislative body of the Empire.

The Cabal that once troubled my liege's realm has been dealt with. After infiltrating the group, I dispatched their leaders and the rest scattered to the wind.

column2: Finally, peace!
My conquests have come to an end...
End your pilgrimage and go back home.
Martial Law
Martial Law has been enforced in this province, with the City Guards patrolling day and night in larger numbers, slightly affecting the local economy but greatly reducing the risk of revolt.
Enslavement
We have conquered this province and enslaved many of the local populace who resisted. These slaves have been distributed to your royal demesne, my liege.
Excellent.
Enslavement
Conquer this province and enslave the populace.
Escaped from a siege
A few whispers in the right ears, some well placed evidence and a scandal at court have. I have done my best to tarnish the lord of [Root.Location.GetName]'s reputation.
Through my manoeuvres at Court and amongst the riff-raff I have uncovered a startling secret about the ruler of [Root.Location.GetName]. Apparently they prefer the company of their own sex!

Incredible. While drinking late one night with a close friend of the ruler of [Root.Location.GetName], they revealed to me a startling secret. [Root.Location.GetTitledFirstName] has a non-Altmer ancestor! I cannot verify the veracity of this claim, but who cares, tomorrow I spread the word!

[Root.Location.GetTitledFirstName] always had a strange air about them, now I know what that is. In my instigations and investigations of scandal at court, I uncovered secret tomes and despicable shrines deep in the cellars. I believe [Root.Location.GetTitledFirstName] is a Necromancer!

For some time now I haven't felt well, this illness that grips my fragile body brings me ever closer to oblivion. The Court Priest is currently administering in the local Temple to those diseased and sick that seek out treatment, perhaps I should pay them a visit.
To the Temple!
Sickness
One of the local Nobles has visited the Temple where I am administering to the sickened masses of my Lord's land. Some terrible illness grips their body, and they seek my healing prowess.
Tend to this poor individual's illness.
Tend to this poor individual's illness.
Tend to this poor individual's illness.
Try to cure this individual's illness with a fickle spell.
Courtier seeks Cure
All my ailments, whatever they may have been have, by the powers of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap], been cured! I can breath with ease once again!
Hurrah!
Cured!

The Priest has failed to cure my diseases, he claims I am cursed by [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap] and his powers will have no effect. I must simply hope my fortitude is able to withstand the ravages of this disease.
*Cough, Cough...Cough*
Failure...
As the priest raised his hands and shouted his voice to the sky, a brilliant white light filled my vision, and then suddenly all was dark, and cold...
Rest in piece...
Death by Misadventure!
I have successfully cured my patient's ailments and sent them on their way.
Excellent
Successful Cure
I have been unfortunate in my administration of the cure, and my patient yet carries some decrepit illness.
For shame!
Failed Cure
Somehow my spell has gone awry and my patient has vanished into oblivion! Alas I have no way to return them to our plane.
Whoops!
Accidental Death
A high ranked Priest or Monk is tending the wounded in this province, and my troublesome injuries can at least be healed!
Visit the Healer
Treatment of Injuries
My injuries proved to be beyond the abilities of the Healer. They have given me a small blessing and ordered I rest and recuperate, though I fear my injuries may ultimately claim me.
Though I pray not.
Failed Healing
My wounds were too great for the Healer to heal me, and my soul now passes into the planes of Oblivion.
Death awaits.
Death
A Courtier has visited me today seeking my healing magics for their wounds. It was simple work to put the broken pieces back together.
May the Gods Bless me.
Healing of Injuries
A Courtier has visited me today seeking healing magics for their wounds, but alas they were beyond the pall of my abilities.
May the Gods bless their recovery.
Injuries Remain
A Courtier has visited me today seeking healing for their wounds. Unfortunately, the wounds were beyond my abilities to heal, and the patient died during my attempts.
A sad day.
Accidental Death

My administrations tending the diseased and sick in [Location.GetName] have proved fruitful beyond all hopes. By administering a regimen of personal hygiene and the distribution of preventative potions and spells, I have increased the general resistance of the local populace!
Disease Resistance Increased
My liege! I have successfully increased the local populace's resistance to ailments and illnesses!

While fulfilling my duties in [Location.GetName] I came into contact with my sick and diseased individuals. Unfortunately, even the most powerful wardings and spells could not prevent me from contracting something from them...
Court Priest Infected!
My liege, while performing my duties in [From.Location.GetName] I have fallen severely ill...
A lack of treatment has caused an injury to become infected. Puss oozes from the stinking, fetid wound, and you feel a slight fever upon your brow.
Disgusting!
Infected Injury
My knowledge of the Restoration school of magick allows me to heal injury or illness. I should use this knowledge to heal my own injuries, lest my mortal body succumb to them.
AI Response
Healing Magick
AI Response
Since time immaterial the Mer have called this land Alinor. I count myself amongst them, and thus, shall I call this land by its rightful name?
This land has been, and always shall be, Alinor!
What do I care for names? They mean little to me.
The Land of Alinor!

Since as far as I can remember, I have been told stories of this land yet known it under a different name. In the common tongue, it is called Summerset, yet to confuse matters it is called Alinor in my Court documents. Perhaps to better aid the people's transition to my rule it should be renamed in the common tongue?
Let it be known, I am the King of Summerset Isle!
The Land of Summerset!
I am Argonian, and this land, my land, is Argonia! No more shall we call it by its human name, let it be Argonia once more!
Hail Argonia, land of the Lizardfolk!
The Land of Argonia!

Since as far as I can remember, I have been told stories of this land yet known it under a different name. In the common tongue, it is called Black Marsh, yet to confuse matters it is called Argonia in my Court documents. Perhaps to better aid the people's transition to my rule it should be named its common tongue name?
Let it be for what it truly is, Black Marsh!
The Land of Black Marsh!
By rights this land is mans, and so to shall it bear the name of our glorious ancestor, Reman Cyrodiil. Let us restore this honoured name and banish the ancient decrepit Ayleids from our thoughts!
Let it us call it by its ancient name, this land is Ayleid!
The Land of the Ayleids
Let it be known that hence forth this land will be Cyrodiil!
The Land of Cyrodiil
With my days growing shorter, and my life slowly but surely dwindling before me, I have no more use of the artifacts I have accumulated over the years.
An elderly relative no longer able to make use of a rare artifact has seen fit to pass it on to a member of their dynasty, seemingly at random you have been chosen to receive this gift.
My absent-mindedness has caused me to misplace my artifacts!
As you stand victorious over your enemies, you notice something glinting from amongst the corpses upon the battlefield.

It is the 450th year of the Second Era, and almost a quarter of a century since the last Potentate of the Empire was assassinated with his heirs, the Lords of Tamriel have descended into petty squabbling Kingdoms, each vying for their own little piece of what once was, though there are others with greater designs, who look to the future, to the Ruby Throne, or perhaps to an Empire of their own...
Let the tale of Tamriel unfold...
The Interregnum

It is the 541st year of the Second Era, and the Reachmen, led by Durcorach Black Drake, are invading High Rock. The Bretons, divided by their petty rivalries and court intrigues are ill-prepared to defend their realms against the invasion, all that is but for Wayrest...
Let the tale of Tamriel unfold...
The Reachmen Invasion

It is the 570th year of the Second Era. The barbarous Kamal of Akavir, commanded by Ada'Soom Dir-Kamal, have invaded Tamriel in two forces, the largest in the north, invading Skyrim & Morrowind's northern provinces, while the second smaller force invades Argonia. The Dunmer, Nords and Argonians, faced with a common enemy have set aside their differences, but can a great alliance stand this day? Or will it fall to old vendettas while its lands are pillaged by the Ice Demons...
Let the tale of Tamriel unfold...
The Kamal Invasion of Tamriel

It is the 582nd year of the Second Era. Three Great Alliances stand in Tamriel. The Aldmeri Dominion, formed of the Altmer of Summerset Isle, the Bosmer of Valenwood and the Khajiit of Elsweyr sees within its Queen, Ayrenn, its manifest destiny to unite Tamriel and enforce upon its people its own benevolent rule. The Daggerfall Covenant, formed in the wake of the Reachmen invasions forty years prior has been revived by the tactful Emeric, seeking to restore order to the chaos of the Interregnum. The Ebonheart Pact, an uneasy alliance of 3 great rivals, Skyrim, Morrowind and Argonia seeks only to maintain the independence of its homelands... but, in the province of Cyrodiil, beset on all sides by enemies, a new alliance, an unholy alliance has been formed. Abnur Tharn, once a petty Colovian Battlemage has somehow usurped leadership of the Elder Council, naming himself Regent and placing his young daughter upon the Ruby Throne as Empress...
Let the tale of Tamriel unfold...
The Alliance War

It is the 830th year of the Second Era, and the Aldmeri Dominion has formed following the attempts of a faction within the Bosmer ruling elite trying to make a peace with their enemies in the Colovian Estates, offering part of Valenwood. The Altmer, upon hearing of this, launched a coup against the rulers and invaded Valenwood, citing a stewardship clause in a thousand year old treaty. Following the coup, the Altmer established a new rulership in Valenwood on behalf of their claimant Anaxemes Camoran, uniting the realms of Altmer and Bosmer.
Let the tale of Tamriel unfold...
The Dominion of Mer
While wandering the market, I came across a horse breeder who had sold all but one of his prize steeds. He offered me a fair price for it...

While browsing the fair's market, the sunlight was suddenly blackened by a huge form. I turned my gaze, and was met with the visage of a powerful warhorse. A prize-winning horse breeder brought this fine example of his stock to the fair, and was selling it at an exorbitant price.

As I passed a small purse to the merchant before me, a monkey leapt up from beneath and took it, running off to a box at the back of the stall. It removed a coin from the purse, bit it between its teeth, and then dropped the purse into the box. I wondered at the creature, and the merchant seemed quite pleased. He told me I could have the trained monkey for only 100 gold.
My loyal steed having served me for many years has finally answered the call of Arkay and entered the afterlife.
The horse served me well.
My loyal pet monkey, who has served me for many years has finally answered the call of Arkay and entered the afterlife.
She served me well.
I am a Greybeard, a hermit living high upon High Hrothgar, dedicating my life to unlocking the secrets of the Voice.
The Way of the Voice.
As a woman, my place is not amongst these misogynistic hermits!
Away with me!
As a child, my place is not amongst these Greybearded hermits.
That child is an abomination! Her mother deserves a punishment greater than anything in history!
Kill it!
Race is important in this world. While it may not define who you are, it defines *what* you are.
Within this world, we are each and everyone one of us born beneath an alignment of the stars, a sign.
My sign is...
While surveying [Root.Location.GetName], I have discovered some previously buried Ayleid ruins!
[Root.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName], your [Root.GetTreasurerName], has discovered Ayleid ruins during [From.GetHerHis] survey mission.
While surveying [Root.Location.GetName], I have discovered some previously buried Dwemer ruins!
[Root.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName], your [Root.GetTreasurerName], has discovered Dwemer ruins during [From.GetHerHis] survey mission.
While surveying [Root.Location.GetName], I have discovered rich deposits of the rare Moonstone!
[Root.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName], your [Root.GetTreasurerName], has discovered Moonstone deposits during [From.GetHerHis] survey mission.
While surveying [Root.Location.GetName], I have discovered rich deposits of rare precious metals!
[Root.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName], your [Root.GetTreasurerName], has discovered Precious Metal Deposits during [From.GetHerHis] survey mission.
While surveying [Root.Location.GetName], I have discovered rich deposits of Malachite, or Glass.
[Root.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName], your [Root.GetTreasurerName], has discovered Glass deposits during [From.GetHerHis] survey mission.
While surveying [Root.Location.GetName], I have discovered rich deposits of Ebony!
[Root.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName], your [Root.GetTreasurerName], has discovered Ebony deposits during [From.GetHerHis] survey mission.
While surveying [Root.Location.GetName], I have discovered rich deposits of Orichalcum!
[Root.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName], your [Root.GetTreasurerName], has discovered Orichalcum deposits during [From.GetHerHis] survey mission.
While surveying [Root.Location.GetName], I have discovered rich Gemstone deposits.
[Root.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName], your [Root.GetTreasurerName], has discovered Gemstone deposits during [From.GetHerHis] survey mission.
While surveying [Root.Location.GetName], I have discovered only very small, negligible veins of minerals.
[Root.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName], your [Root.GetTreasurerName], has discovered depleted deposits during [From.GetHerHis] survey mission.
While out alone surveying the land, [Root.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName], your [Root.GetTreasurerName], has run into a group of bandits.
Ore Deposits Discovered!
Dwemer Ruins Discovered!
Moonstone Deposits Discovered!
Precious Metal Deposits Discovered!
Glass Deposits Discovered!
Ebony Deposits Discovered!
Orichalcum Deposits Discovered!
Gemstone Deposits Discovered!
Depleted Deposits Discovered!
Steward accosted by Bandits!

There once was a time when I would lead my men into battle, a time when I thought I was destined to rule the world. Once they called me a Warlord, but no longer. My thirst for conquest has been satiated...
I am at last content.
As a Briarheart, my mind, body and soul are not my own. I have tried to turn from my masters, and now my body is dust...
As a Hagraven, my mind, body and soul are not my own. I have tried to turn from my masters, and now my body is dust...
I should have stayed a Hagraven Cultist!
Forgive me Hagravens!
This time I have spent leading men into the fray of battle has taught me many lessons, and I now have a greater understanding of the arts of war.
Excellent.
I'm a proud Altmer!
I'm a strong Nord!
I'm a adventurous Redguard!
I'm a traditional Dunmer!
I'm a seafaring Islander!
I'm a maritime Maormer!
I'm a fearless Orsimer!
I'm an agile Bosmer!
I'm a furry Khajiit!
I'm a nimble Argonian!
I'm a humble Breton!
I'm a warmongering Colovian!
I'm a mercantile Nibenean!
I'm a diplomatic Imperial!
By Sheogorath! I don't remember my own race!
I inherited my mother's race...
Let [From.GetHerHim] rot in jail!
What is done is done. Let [From.GetHerHim] go.

After many months studying the campaigns of Reman Cyrodiil, you have acquired many fascinating insights and gained new wisdom in military matters. You realize that the Art of War might be well worth studying.
column3: Après des mois passés à étudier les campagnes de Reman Cyrodiil, vous avez acquis de nombreuses et fascinantes connaissances, ainsi qu'une nouvelle vision de la chose militaire. Vous pensez qu'il pourrait être bon de vous plonger dans l'étude de l'art de la Guerre.
column4: Nach mehreren Monaten des Studiums der Feldzüge Reman Cyrodiil, durch das Ihr viele neue Erkenntnisse gewannt, hat sich Euer Verständnis für militärische Belange deutlich verbessert. Ihr erkennt, dass das Studium der Kriegskunst sich durchaus lohnen könnte.
column6: Después de muchos meses estudiando las campañas de Reman Cyrodiil, has aprendido muchas cosas sobre asuntos militares. Te parece que el Arte de la Guerra merece la pena estudiarla bien.

column2: My waist is growing bigger... so is my appetite!
column3: Ma taille s’épaissit à mesure que mon appétit augmente !
column4: Mein Wanst wächst ... und auch mein Appetit!
column6: Mi cintura aumenta... ¡como mi apetito!

column2: Praise [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]! My fierce rival has also become a follower of the new religion! Hallelujah!
column3: [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] soit loué ! Mon ennemi juré est également devenu un nouvel adepte de Dieu ! Alléluia !
column4: Gepriesen sei [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]! Mein ärgster Rivale ist ein Anhänger des neuen Weges Christi geworden! Hallelujah!
column6: ¡Alabado sea [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]! ¡Mi acérrimo rival se ha convertido en un seguidor de la nueva fe de Cristo! ¡Aleluya!

column2: The [Root.Religion.GetName] priests are constantly pestering me about religion, [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and money to the poor. No matter what I do they won't leave me alone!
column3: Les imams de la religion [Root.Religion.GetName] me harcèlent sans cesse à propos de religion, de [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] et d'argent pour la zakat. Quoi que je fasse, que je promette de prier plus ou de lire le Coran de façon plus assidue, ils ne me laissent jamais en paix !
column4: Die [Root.Religion.GetName] Imamehe belästigen mich ständig mit Religion, [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] und Geld für die Zakat. Egal was ich tue, mehr zu beten verspreche oder den Koran noch genauer zu lesen, sie ließen mich nicht in Ruhe!
column6: Los imames de [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] se la pasan atosigándome con preguntas sobre la religión, ???[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]  y dinero para el azaque. Ellos no me dejarán en paz incluso si les prometo que rezaré más o que leeré con más cuidado el Corán.

column2: Excuse me, I was invited to a local ball and don't know what's the appropriate dressing code. Could you help me?

While researching economic theories and advancements in [Location.GetName], I came across a treatise on trade practices in the Reman Empire. While much of it was irrelevant, there were some outstanding ideas within.
My liege, I have uncovered an old treatise on economic theory that contains some excellent ideas, shall I implement them in [From.Location.GetName]?
A letter arrives from your liege informing you of the order to implement the ideas from the treatise you recently discovered.
My liege, I have uncovered an old treatise on economic theory that contradicts my own and has set back my research in [From.Location.GetName].
A noble in [Root.Location.GetName] caught me trying to rally the local dissidents.
[From.Liege.GetTitledName]'s Marshal [From.GetTitledName] was found trying to rally dissidents and rebels in [From.Location.GetName]!

I received word that your Marshal [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has been trying to rally dissidents in one of my provinces. This is intolerable and as to stop further interference I have arrested [FromFrom.GetHerHim]!

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

I received word that you have been trying to rally dissidents in one of my provinces. I will let it pass. This time.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
I have been cornered by the City Guard while attempting to rally rebels in [Root.Location.GetName]. What course of action shall I take?
Actions always come with consequences, and my 'encounter' with the Guards is no different. I haven't quite felt like myself since then, perhaps there is something seriously wrong with me.
I have visited the chirurgeon and received some terrible news! My 'encounter' with the Guards has given me a case of Greenspore!
I have visited the chirurgeon and apparently it must have been something I ate...

The chirurgeon has informed me I am physically fine but my soul feels as if it has been torn asunder, shattered into a million pieces by the despicable things I did with those Guards. How will I ever live with myself?
While attending the chirurgeon, I felt sudden pains and cramping in my stomach. A few hours later, and I am holding the wailing bastard of some unknown city guardsman...

After the guards were finished with me, I slipped away while they congratulated each other, I did not truly believe they would keep their word. As I ride back toward my home, I don't quite feel myself any more...
Actions always come with consequences, and my 'encounter' with the Guards is no different. I haven't quite felt like myself since then, perhaps there is something seriously wrong with me.
My liege, I have successfully suppressed rebellious sentiments and unrest in [From.Location.GetName], the province should remain peaceful... for a time at least.
My overly oppressive and zealous measures have riled up the populace in [Root.Location.GetName].
My liege, the oppressive measures taken by one of my subordinates in [From.Location.GetName] has only served to anger the local populace!
While overseeing the Garrisons in [Root.Location.GetName] I was accosted at night by a large group of hooded individuals.
My liege, while enforcing martial law in [From.Location.GetName], I was beset in the night by a group of hooded individuals and wounded in my attempt to fend them off.
My liege, while enforcing martial law in [From.Location.GetName], I was beset in the night by a group of hooded individuals and maimed in my attempt to fend them off.
I have located and eliminated a Cabal in [Root.Location.GetName], they shall trouble these lands no more.

As I look at both my child and the children of my peers, I feel mine woefully inadequate compared to theirs! While their child does sums and counts, knows poetry, can read and even write, mine cannot even stand upright without falling over. I see the way they look at me - they think I'm not even as good as the serfs over which I rule.  I didn't know what to do, but the tales my elders once told me of ancient aldmeri customs brought an idea to light...
I had confided with some people I wanted to arrange for my child to die. I waited for some time for the opportunity to arise, and so it had today.

I've noticed my child walking too far, too much, going places where he shouldn't go. Whenever I tell him not to wander off, my child just gets lost! The other day, bruises and cuts were a common sight all over his scales. It's not safe, I keep saying, in the swamp - there are so many different dangers hiding, be they crocodiles or bandits, but I feel my warnings fall on deaf ears...

A rare phenomenon has occurred when the moons of Masser and Secunda eclipsed each other, briefly revealing a smaller, third moon. A lowborn courtier went into labour this night, giving birth to only a single Khajiit, it is no doubt that this newborn Khajiit will be the Mane.

The old Mane died, may he always walk on warm sands, and a new Mane is selected among the kittens of Elsweyr. As tradition dictates, only a Khajiit born during the alignment of the Moons is born with spiritual connection to the Gods, and thus, a Mane. May his rule be long and prosperous to all Elsweyr!
The old [Root.GetTitle] died, may [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] guard his soul, and a new one is elected among the veteran soldiers. Let his command be worthy and just.
I do not understand why we are fighting fellow worshipers of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]?
column3: Je ne comprends pas pourquoi nous combattons d’autres catholiques.
column4: Ich verstehe nicht, warum wir gegen katholische Glaubensbrüder kämpfen!
column6: No entiendo por qué luchamos contra otros católicos.

column2: Serving [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] should be our goal in life. How can I do it the best way?
column3: Servir Dieu devrait être notre but dans la vie. Comment faire au mieux ?
column4: Der Gottesdienst sollte unser Lebensziel sein. Wie stelle ich das bestmöglich an?
column6: Nuestro objetivo en la vida debería ser servir a Dios. ¿Cuál es el mejor modo de hacerlo?

column2: The [From.GetJobTitle] of [From.Host.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [From.GetTitledName], accuses me of heresy and have declared me a heretic!
column3: Le(la) [From.GetJobTitle] de [From.Host.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [From.GetTitledName], m’accuse d’hérésie !
column4: Der [From.GetJobTitle] von [From.Host.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [From.GetTitledName], klagte mich der Häresie an und erklärte mich zum Ketzer!
column6: ¡El [From.GetJobTitle] de [From.Host.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [From.GetTitledName], me acusa de herejía y me ha declarado hereje!

column2:
My [Root.GetTitle], word has reached me that your Lord Spiritual has accused me of heresy! I implore you, as a Gods-fearing, devout of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] to another Gods-fearing, devout of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] to believe me when I tell you I am not a heretic!

Your humble [From.GetTitle],
[From.GetTitledName]
column3:
Mon(Ma) [Root.GetTitle], J’ai appris que votre Chapelain m’accuse d’hérésie ! C’est en fidèle de la foi [Root.Religion.GetName] que je vous supplie, fidèle de la foi [Root.Religion.GetName], de me croire quand je vous dis que je ne suis pas un(e) hérétique !

Votre humble [From.GetTitle],
[From.GetTitledName]
column4:
Mein [Root.GetTitle], ich hörte, dass Euer Hofkaplan mich der Ketzerei bezichtigt! Ich bitte Euch sehr, von einem gottesfürchtigen, frommen [Root.Religion.GetName] zum anderen gottesfürchtigen, frommen [Root.Religion.GetName], mir zu glauben, wenn ich Euch sage, dass ich kein Ketzer bin!

Euer ergebener [From.GetTitle],
[From.GetTitledName]
column6:
¡Mi [Root.GetTitle], ha llegado a mis oídos que su capellán me acusa de herejía! ¡Le ruego, de fiel creyente del [Root.Religion.GetName] a fiel creyente del [Root.Religion.GetName], que me crea cuando le digo que no he cometido herejía!

Su humilde [From.GetTitle],
[From.GetTitledName]

column2: My [Root.GetTitle], I ask for your forgiveness as a pious [From.Religion.GetName]! My Lord Spiritual's precipitous conclusion will no longer cause you any more grievance as I personally will make sure your favour will be known as a fact and not a question.\nYour humble [From.GetTitle],\n[From.GetTitledName]
column3: Mon(Ma) [Root.GetTitle], Je vous présente mes excuses en tant que fidèle de la foi [From.Religion.GetName] ! Les conclusions hâtives de mon Chapelain ne vous porteront plus préjudice et je veillerai personnellement à ce que votre piété ne soit plus remise en question.\nVotre humble [From.GetTitle],\n[From.GetTitledName]
column4: Mein [Root.GetTitle], als frommer [From.Religion.GetName] bitte ich um Eure Vergebung! Die überstürzte Schlussfolgerung meines Hofkaplans wird Euch keinen weiteren Kummer machen, da ich persönlich dafür sorgen werde, dass Eure Frömmigkeit für die Öffentlichkeit zur Tatsache wird, nicht zur Frage.\nEuer ergebener [From.GetTitle],\n[From.GetTitledName]
column6: ¡Mi [Root.GetTitle], le pido perdón como fiel creyente del [From.Religion.GetName]! La precipitada conclusión de mi capellán dejará de causarle más molestias, ya que me aseguraré personalmente de que su devoción quede fuera de duda.\nSu humilde [From.GetTitle],\n[From.GetTitledName]

column2: My Lord Spiritual, after investigating the heretic further I can assure you that he is a devout [From.Religion.GetName] and a Gods-fearing man. If this mistake recur I will not be as understanding. Make sure the heretic really is a heretic before you falsely accuse anyone.\n\n[From.GetTitledName]
column3: Cher Chapelain, Après avoir examiné ce soi-disant cas d’hérésie, je peux vous assurer que la personne concernée est fidèle à la foi [From.Religion.GetName] et affiche une grande piété. Ma compréhension pourrait être mise à mal en cas de nouvelle erreur de votre part. Veillez à ce que la personne montrée du doigt soit vraiment hérétique avant de porter de telles accusations.\n\n[From.GetTitledName]
column4: Mein Hofkaplan, nach weiterer Nachforschung in das Leben des Ketzers kann ich Euch versichern, dass er ein frommer [From.Religion.GetName] und ein gottesfürchtiger Mann ist. Sollte dieser Fehler sich wiederholen, werde ich allerdings nicht mehr so viel Verständnis zeigen. Stellt sicher, dass ein Ketzer wirklich einer ist, bevor Ihr falsche Anschuldigungen erhebt.\n\n[From.GetTitledName]
column6: Mi capellán, tras investigar al hereje más a fondo, puedo asegurarle que ese hombre es un devoto creyente del [From.Religion.GetName]. La próxima vez que esto se repita no tendré tanta comprensión. Asegúrese de que el hereje sea tal antes de lanzar falsas acusaciones.\n\n[From.GetTitledName]

column2:
My lord, your [Root.GetChancellorName] [FromFrom.GetTitledName] tried to encourage me to turn against my liege [From.Liege.GetTitledName]! This shameless act can not go unpunished and to stop further interference I have thus decided to imprison your [Root.GetChancellorName] for an indefinite period of time.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
column3:
Mon Seigneur, votre [Root.GetChancellorName] [FromFrom.GetTitledName] a essayé de m'encourager à me retourner contre mon seigneur [From.Liege.GetTitledName] ! Cet acte honteux ne doit pas rester impuni et pour empêcher toute immixtion future, j'ai décidé d'emprisonner votre [Root.GetChancellorName] pour une période indéfinie.

Signé,
[From.GetTitledName]
column4: Mein Lord, Euer [Root.GetChancellorName] [FromFrom.GetTitledName]hat versucht mich dazu zu bringen, mich gegen meinen Lehnsherren [From.Liege.GetTitledName] zu wenden! Dies ist ein schamloser Akt, der nicht ungestraft bleiben darf - um weitere Einmischung zu verhindern, habe ich beschlossen,...

column2:
I have received word that your [Root.GetChancellorName] was trying to agitate the nobles of my realm by spreading lies about me in [FromFrom.Location.GetName]! Rest assured that this outrageous behaviour will not stand!

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
column3:
J’ai appris que votre [Root.GetChancellorName] essaie de semer la discorde parmi les nobles de mon Royaume en répandant des mensonges me concernant à [FromFrom.Location.GetName] ! Je vous prie de croire que de tels agissements ne resteront pas impunis !

Signé,
[From.GetTitledName]
column4:
Ich habe vernommen, dass Euer [Root.GetChancellorName] versuchte, die Adligen meines Reichs aufzuhetzen, indem er in [FromFrom.Location.GetName] Lügen verbreitete! Seid versichert, dass ich diese Tat nicht ungesühnt lassen werde!

Gezeichnet,
[From.GetTitledName]
column6:
¡Ha llegado a mis oídos que el [Root.GetChancellorName] intentaba sembrar la discordia entre los nobles de mi reino difundiendo mentiras sobre mí en  [FromFrom.Location.GetName]! ¡Puedo asegurarle que no toleraré semejante afrenta!

Firmado,
[From.GetTitledName]
