In this screen you can see the Electors.These are the ones responsible for electing a new Religious Leader among themselves when the old one dies. It also shows who is likely to be given title of cardinal if a spot opens up.
column3: Cette vue vous montre le Collège des cardinaux. Ce sont eux qui sont responsables d'élire un nouveau pape parmi eux lorsque le pape actuel meurt. Cette vue montre également qui a les meilleures chances de devenir cardinal si une place se libère.
column4: In dieser Übersicht seht Ihr das Kolleg der Kardinäle. Sie sind für die Wahl des neuen Papstes verantwortlich. Angezeigt wird auch, wer wahrscheinlich zum Kardinal ernannt wird, wenn eine Position frei wird.
column6: En esta pantalla podéis ver el Colegio de Cardenalicio. Son los únicos responsables de la elección entre sus miembros de un nuevo Papa cuando el antiguo muere. También muestra quién tiene probabilidad de recibir un título de cardenal si hay una vacante.

column2: Every priest in the world can be given a seat as one of the Electors. Every priest have a score which the Religious Head uses to decide who gets the open spot. This score is calculated from a wide range of factors but you can also directly influence it by promising money to the Religious Leader. This will make it much more likely that he will choose a bishop from your realm.
column3: Tout évêque catholique du monde peut recevoir un siège au Collège des cardinaux. Tout évêque possède un score que le pape utilise pour choisir qui obtiendra ce siège. Un grand nombre de facteurs entre en compte dans le calcul de ce score, et vous pouvez également l'influencer directement en promettant de l'argent au pape. Cette action rendra beaucoup plus probable la nomination d'un évêque de votre royaume.
column4: Jeder katholische Bischof kann einen Sitz im Kolleg der Kardinäle erhalten. Jeder Bischof hat eine Wertung, wobei der Papst letztlich die Entscheidung trifft. Die Wertung errechnet sich aus einer Reihe von Faktoren, aber Ihr könnt Einfluss nehmen, indem Ihr dem Papst eine Geldspende in Aussicht stellt. Dadurch wird die Wahrscheinlichkeit, dass ein Bischof Eures Reiches gewählt wird, enorm gesteigert.
column6: Cualquier obispo del mundo puede recibir un asiento en el Colegio Cardenalicio. Todos los obispos tienen una puntuación que le sirve al Papa para decidir quién ocupa la vacante. La puntuación se basa en una amplia gama de factores, pero se puede influir directamente sobre ella prometiendo dinero al Papa. De este modo es mucho más probable que escoja a un obispo de vuestro reino.

column2: Each elector has a single vote he can cast for who he wants to become the next Religious Leader. The one with the most support is known as the Favorite and is most likely to become the new leader.
column3: Chaque cardinal possède une voix qu'il peut utiliser pour élire celui qu'il souhaite voir saint-père de l'Église catholique. Celui qui bénéficie du plus grand soutien est désigné sous le nom de Preferatus, et c'est lui qui est le plus susceptible de devenir le prochain pape.
column4: Jeder Kardinal hat eine Stimme, die er seinem bevorzugten Kandidaten für das Amt des Papstes geben kann. Derjenige mit den meisten Stimmen wird Preferatus genannt und hat die besten Aussichten, zum neuen Papst ernannt zu werden.
column6: Cada cardenal cuenta con un único voto que otorgará al que desea que sea el próximo Santo Padre de la Iglesia Católica. El que recibe más apoyo, conocido como el Preferatus, es el que más probabilidades tiene de convertirse en el nuevo Papa.

column3: La vue des cardinaux
column4: Kardinals-Übersicht
column6: La perspectiva del Cardenal

column2: In Elder Kings, you play a feudal lord in Tamriel. Your goal is to secure as much land and prestige as possible for yourself and, when the time comes, your successors. You can see your portrait in the upper-left corner. Click the portrait to find out who your character is.
column3: Dans Crusader Kings II, vous incarnez un Seigneur féodal dans l’Europe médiévale. Votre objectif consiste à renforcer vos terres et votre prestige pour vous-même, et le moment venu, pour vos successeurs. Cliquez sur votre portrait, qui s’affiche en haut à gauche de l’écran, pour connaître votre personnage.
column4: In Crusader Kings II spielt Ihr einen feudalen Fürsten im europäischen Mittelalter. Euer Ziel ist, Euch und Euren Nachfolgern so viel Land und Prestige zu sichern wie möglich. Euer Portrait seht Ihr in der oberen linken Bildschirmecke. Lernt nun Euren Charakter kennen, indem Ihr auf das Portrait klickt.
column6: En Crusader Kings II, eres un señor feudal en la Europa medieval. Tu objetivo es acumul...

My vassal, [From.GetTitledName] has rebelled against me in a bid for independence, their ultimate aim to re-establish a petty Kingdom!

Your Liege has ordered the High Court convene to hear the pleas of the common folk and nobles alike. As the High Judge of the realm, it is your official responsibility to serve as your liege's voice and will, your word carrying the same weight, and your judgements the final say.

Before the Court today stands a polarising case of a lord's wrothful nature. The Lord in question massacred the flock of a shepherd, and while this issue would normally be handled outside of the Court, it has managed to rile up the lowborn populace of the realm. On the one hand, the peasants feel the Lord has overstepped his remit, on the other, the Nobles feel the peasants are questioning their right to rule.
The shepherd approaches your chair, his nerves plainly obvious in the way his body shook. The rabble assembled in the room begins shouting their support to him, requiring you to call for order.

He relates to you a story of a missing sheep wandering onto the Lord's land from the public grazelands, and the wrothful lord, who regularly beat his servants, appeared like a mad-man as he ran too and fro, killing not only the sheep upon his land, but the entire flock. When the lord was done, he simply turned to the shepherd, and told him he best meet the quota, or it'll be his family next.

The Lord stands with a furious look upon his face, and approaches the bench, giving a violent scowl in the direction of the shepherd. As he stands before you, he delivers his own version of events, relating how the shepherd's flock in its entirety was destroying his prized field, and though he tried to have the shepherd remove them, the shepherd had simply laughed and turned his back. The slaughter, he explained, was the last resort of a desperate lord.
After hearing the pleas of the participants in the trial, you must determine which party holds the most guilty, and pass judgement upon them.
After many months of hearing the pleas of the innocent and guilty alike, you finally adjourn the High Court for the final time, or at least until it is convened once again by your liege.
After many months of hearing the pleas of the innocent and guilty alike, your Judge has adjourned the High Court.
Holding War Games
This individual has ordered his Master-at-Arms to hold war games for the realm's Army, temporarily decreasing the realm's preparedness for war.
Convene High Court
Convene the High Court and have your appointed Judge hear the pleas of the common folk and nobles of the realm, dispensing justice how they see fit in your name.
Hold War Games
Order your Master-at-Arms to organise and host a series of war games, allowing your Army to practice formation fighting and tactics under simulated battle conditions, hardening them for real warfare.
Paint it honestly, depict my true form, warts and all.

As I sat in my ancestor's tomb and meditated before their bones, I found myself contemplating my own life, and the lives of those that walked before me. It was almost as if I could hear my ancestors whispering in the darkness, and in these moments my mind was calm and still.
I must visit again sometime.

As I sat in my ancestor's tomb and meditated before their bones, I found myself contemplating my own life, and the lives of those that walked before me. In these moments of calm stillness, as I listened to my own thoughts and sought to be guided by those of my ancestors, I found myself feeling a deep connection with my kin, and they with me.
We are truely one of a greater whole.

As I sat in my ancestor's tomb, meditating, I found myself drifting off to sleep, the warm, musty air and the dark lighting only adding to my fatigue. Unfortunately, my snoring alerted my family, and I suffered their scowls all the way home for dishonouring my ancestors.
Oh dear...
You have slighted your ancestor's memories!
Your family is pleased at your observance of your ancestors.
Gain favour for your observance of your ancestors.

A subject of yours has gained a few moments of your time and is pressing the issue of their lack of appointment, they hold neither a position upon your Small Council, nor other title of merit at Court and seek to remedy their situation...

I have served my realm and my liege admirably for some time now but have yet to be granted any real position at court. Today I have gained a moment alone with my liege, and I shall use the time to press the issue.
My liege, may I have a moment..?
A position at Court is long past due, I accept your appointment.
I don't have time for this.
Diplomatically refuse.
Lie and flatter the subject, but refuse them an appointment.
How dare you bother me with such trivial matters! GUARDS!
Honour the Ancestors
Visit the Family Tombs and meditate before the bones of your ancestors.
An enemy has caused grievous harm to your House, and there is only one way to restore our honour!

Born from the chaos following the assassination of the Potentate, the Imperial Commune is a council of wealthy merchants and nobles that found themselves trapped in the Imperial Isle, surrounded by enemies.

A few short weeks ago the Lord Provost Sergius Ottus died, and the House Lex arose to the position of prominence, however his rulership is a precarious one, for prior to his death the former Lord Provost reformed the City Guard into the first Legion seen in Cyrodiil since the days of the Reman Empire.

This Legion, the Legio Cyrodiil, is led by Sergius's eldest son, Severus, a man who already at age 28 has several victories under his belt. Popularity of Severus is at a high, and the new Lord Provost may find himself very soon joining his predecessor...
The Imperial Commune

Incited Rebellion
Foreign Interlopers have incited the local populace in this province into open rebellion against their lords.

Since coming to [Root.Location.GetName] on my mission I have been making contact with local dissidents, encouraging their behaviour. Under my guidance, we have managed to cause widespread discontent amongst the peasants.
My liege, I have successfully made contact with local dissidents in [From.Location.GetName], and together we have managed to cause unrest amongst the local peasants.
An messenger arrives from [From.Location.GetName]: My liege! The Peasants in [From.Location.GetName] are voicing discontent, and there is widespread unrest in the region!

My incitement in [Root.Location.GetName] has proved a resounding success, the peasants are arming themselves with pitchforks, kitchen utensils and anything else they can lay their hands on. Soon they will form into an open rebellion, and my mission here will have been a complete success!
My liege, I have successfully incited rebellion in [From.Location.GetName].

Incredible work.

The Interregnum of the second era was a chaotic time where petty feudal lords fought incessant wars and peasants were left to fend for themselves. Ne'er-do-wells, thieves, smugglers and wild beasts infested many places in the world, and famine was a common problem from many communities...
Chaos Interregnum

For High Rock!

High Rock shall prevail!
There is no point in resisting...

column6: Esta ley determina quién designa a los obispos: el Papa o el señor seglar.

column2: I am in your debt, accept this gift for saving my life.
In Command
[Root.GetBestName] is leading an Army in the field.
Is this a good thing, or a bad thing?
I shall soon join their ranks, my body cursed to guard this amulet!
Islander Modifier
Islands
It's probably a mistake.
I will free the slaves, by sword if I have to!
I wonder what it is...
[FromFrom.GetFirstName] the Hero of [From.GetName] has arrived at the court of [Root.GetTitledName].
column3: [FromFrom.GetFirstName] la Pucelle de [From.GetName] arrive à la cour de [Root.GetTitledName].

column6: [FromFrom.GetFirstName], la Doncella de [From.GetName], ha llegado a la corte de [Root.GetTitledName].

column2: Joined War Against Me
High Court
The High Court of the Realm is currently in session, hearing the pleas of the common people and nobles alike.

Claim Wintermost Duchies of Akavir
Get claim on Duchy of Wanir, Duchy of Emara, Duchy of Jomi-Nam and Duchy of Shuyurru.
Claim Winter Duchies of Akavir
Get claim on Duchy of Winter's Keep and Duchy of Rakemis.
You cannot press claims until your armies gather and have enough rations for another war unless its a small or defensive one.
One scamp?! ONE!? *Sigh* I guess it's better than nothing.
What just happened!?

A letter arrives from the Harbour Master. The Overlord of your realm has requisitioned a number of Merchant Galleys for his navy, some of yours were amongst them. A few gold pieces have been included as recompense, and a promise to return the ships when the war is done.

A scribe in your employ, while browsing ancient genealogical tomes has uncovered irrefutable evidence of an ancestral link to an ancient and renowned bloodline. The link is though through various matrilineal and bastard lines, if we claim the Bloodline we may become something of a laughing stock...
Who cares? I am a true descendent!
A Bloodline does not denote greatness, only acts do.
Khajiit Culturist
This person has embraced Khajiit Culture.
Khajiit Modifier
Killed an Old One.
A Kingdom bows!
This kingdom did not offer any resistance and bowed under your rule!
Resistance was futile...
Large Demesne
Your large demesne makes it difficult to properly administrate your realm.
Refresh for Immortality
Our Liege has seen fit to revoke our minor titles, a travesty!
Damn him!
The Emperor has revoked my title as Champion of Cyrodiil!
Damn him!
The Emperor has kicked me from the Order of the Dragon!
Damn him!
I am no longer the favoured Eunuch of our glorious Emperor!
The sorrow!
AI Event to trigger narratives!

The Knahaten Flu, a mysterious plague originating from deep within Argonia has spread forth into Tamriel! This plague is an almost guaranteed death sentence for any who catch it, and has the potential to wipe out entire dynasties.
Knahaten Flu
Save the healthy, abandon the ill! The Knahaten Flu has struck this county!.
Knahaten Immunity
Argonians are immune to the ill effects of the Knahaten Flu.
A valiant Knight will appear at Court.
That was lucky!
What?
Oh damn!
Oof!
Ouch!
That was close.
That was...convenient.

Steward's Cup

An old, chipped pewter cup, the underside is enchanted with daedric symbols and incantations. It is said this drab object once belonged to an ancient Lord's Steward who was fond of drink but not of his duties, so his Lord had it enchanted allowing the man to remain inebriated but still able to perform. Drinking regularly from the cup seems to strengthen your abilities as a Steward.
Enchanted Ledgers
A set of specially enchanted, self-writing ledgers. Any bookkeeper utilising these will have their work time cut drastically, increasing their work efficiency.
You have obtained the Steward's Cup.

You have successfully convinced the Bandits that, despite your attire and mannerisms, you are a starving second-rate comedian. They however find your jokes to be hilarious and spend the entire night in your company. As the bandits each fell asleep one by one, drunk from their mead and ales, you slip off into the darkness.
Your encounter has, alas, ended in your death...
Your encounter has ended in a very severe beating!
Your encounter has ended in a beating.
You loot the corpses of your fallen foes in search of wealth and treasures.
I wonder what I'll find...
You manage to flee from your quarry. Unfortunately in the frantic dash to safety you dropped a small coin purse.

Your attempts to use Command Animal upon the wolves was a success. You had them keep you company for awhile to fend off any other would be attackers, but as you felt the spell weakening you command them into a rushing river which washed them safely downstream.

Disease, famine, war and other ill tidings have taken their toll upon our realm. What little population has survived in this province, has emigrated beyond our borders, and this place is now a desolate shadow of what it once was.
Offer incentives to keep the population from emigrating and encourage new settlers.
These are hard times we face.
Rubies! I've discovered Rubies! A group of miners have reported uncovering a large vein of Gemstones. Further investigation revealed a rich deposit beneath the hard rock.
Gemstone Deposits
Ooh, shiny!
Gold! Quicksilver! Conundrum! A group of miners have reported uncovering a large vein of Precious Metals. Further investigation revealed a rich deposit beneath the hard rock.
Precious Metals
Ooh, shiny!
Orichalcum! I've discovered Orichalcum! A group of miners have reported uncovering a large vein of Orichalcum. Further investigation revealed a rich deposit beneath the hard rock.
Orichalcum Deposits
Excellent
Ebony! I've discovered Ebony! A group of miners have reported uncovering a large vein of Ebony. Further investigation revealed a rich deposit beneath the hard rock.
Ebony Deposits
Excellent
Glass! I've discovered Glass! A group of miners have reported uncovering a large vein of Malachite. Further investigation revealed a rich deposit beneath the hard rock.
Malachite Deposits
Excellent
Moonstone! I've discovered Moonstone! A group of miners have reported uncovering a large vein of Moonstone. Further investigation revealed a rich deposit beneath the hard rock.
Moonstone Deposits
Excellent

Miners and Prospectors in our province have reported a lack of new quality veins in our mines. They believe this indicates we have exhausted the existing deposits in our province, hampering the local economy.
Depleted Deposits
Damn.
Sire, our people have exhausted the previously discovered rare deposits, all that remains are a few low quality veins, severely hampering our local economy.
Depleted Deposits
Damn.

Hardships faced by the people in this province have caused a sudden decline in the population. While the Court remains active, beyond the gilded halls, the streets of the settlements, and the roads between lay empty, with only a few sparse, resolute inhabitants remaining.
Offer incentives to keep stabilise the population and encourage new settlers.
It's all so quiet.

For whatever reason, be it employment, safety in numbers, bountiful harvests or just a feeling of some spiritual connection, a great number of settlers from other lands have caused the population in this province to explode. With such a dense number of people, wealth, and labour, are easy to come by, but the people are fickle, and as they congregate into large Guilds and organisations, it becomes harder to suppress their free thinking attitudes.
We can't afford the instability this may cause.
Welcome these settlers with open arms.

Ayleid ruins have been discovered! If it is my Lord's preference, we can send excavation teams to study the ruins, perhaps we may find some useful use to advance our understanding of the Ayleid's intricate economical theory. Alternatively we can open the ruins up to Adventurers, then tax these individuals for anything they remove. Or, we could simply ignore the ruins, after all there may be undead or other foul beings within.
Send the excavation teams!
Invite Adventurers to explore the ruins.
I will explore the ruins, to glory and...loot!
I dare not open the ruins!

Dwemer ruins have been discovered! If it is my Lord's preference, we can send excavation teams to study the ruins, perhaps we may find some useful clues to advance our understanding of the Dwemer's intricate martial theory. Alternatively we can open the ruins up to Adventurers, then tax these individuals for anything they remove. Or, we could simply ignore the ruins, after all there may be undead or other foul beings within.
Send the excavation teams!
Invite Adventurers to explore the ruins.
I will explore the ruins, to glory and...loot!
I dare not open the ruins!
This province is on the verge of a cultural renaissance. Artisans, playwrights and other colourful individuals are congregating in our settlements and new works are a daily occurance.
Allow the Renaissance to sweep our Province!
We cannot allow such free thinking at this time, disperse the crowds!

A recent survey of this province has revealed several Kwama Colonies, we could set up Mines to harvest the Eggs increasing our local economy for a small investment, or we could ignore them, although the Colony may pose a hazard to our populace.
Establish the Egg Mines.
I have more important things to think about than eggs!
The Kwama Colonies, for so long simply ignored by our people, have burst open, and hundreds of Foragers and Kwama Workers descended upon our farmlands like locusts.
Damn!

My liege, our subjects report sightings of large gatherings of Goblins around Caves and watering holes within our province, and merchants complain with alarming frequency of their caravans being harassed by the small green creatures!
Send the Marshal and his men to deal with this problem.
Hand me my sword, I'll take care of these bastards!
What do you expect me to do about it?!
We are at war my good man! I have more pressing concerns!
Put out the call for Adventurers to deal with this problem!
Our Marshal has successfully defeated the Goblins and broken their numbers, what few remain are easy pickings for normal folk.
Huzzah!
Our Marshal has failed in his task to defeat the Goblins. Though their numbers are somewhat less, they still plague our lands.
Drats!
Our Marshal has successfully defeated the Goblins, but at the cost of his own life. He gave himself for the Realm. Three cheers for the Marshal!
Hurrah! Hurrah! Hurrah!
I have single-handedly defeated the Goblin Shamans and dispersed their clans to the winds!
Hurrah!
The...the Goblins were too many. I managed to cut down their numbers, but they still terrorise my land...
Drats!
The...the Goblins! There are too many...I...I can't break through!
Fight them to the death!
The Numidium, a great towering titan, the Brass God, lies dormant within our keeping.
It is a magnificent sight!
Adventurers have been attracted to our realm as of late, attracted by tales of ancient ruins or wild bands of monstrous creatures.
My adventurous lifestyle has attracted a great swathe of adventurers to my realm, hoping to bask in the glory of one of their own ascended to a position of great position.

Of late a great number of Adventurers and their ilk have been wandering into my realm. Generally they don't cause much of an issue, however in larger numbers they can unsettle the local populace and often conflicts arise between differing parties.
An adventurer has wandered through our Court seeking employment. Positions upon our Council lie empty, perhaps this newcomer would be a suitable candidate?
A wealthy trader from one of my provinces has arrived at court seeking position in return for financial favour.
In light of our realm's almost destitute status, a Magistrate from one of my less poorer provinces has come forth offering a gift of gold to the realm's coffers in exchange for a place at Court.
They better not break anything!
I can always use skilled Courtiers.
There is no room at my court.
Graciously accept the gift and welcome the Magistrate to court.

As Regent, you have been passed a letter intended for your liege, As the chief spiritual advisor of your faith, I am most concerned that you allow heretics as your counsel. They should immediately be removed from position their position...
column3: Je suis très inquiet que vous preniez des conseillers hérétiques auprès de vous. Ils devraient être démis de leurs fonctions immédiatement.
column4: Es besorgt mich zu sehen, dass Ihr Euch von Ketzern beraten lasst. Sie sollten umgehend ihres Amtes enthoben werden!
column6: Me preocupa que admitas a herejes como consejeros. Deberían ser retirados de sus cargos inmediatamente.

column2: I will destroy you!
I must flee!
Have at you foul beasts!
I must try to sneak past them.
Attempt to converse.

You have turned from the Cult of Clavicus Vile. Your soulless body was maintained in a state of immortality upon Nirn by its connection to your soul within Clavicus's realm. That connection is now severed and your body has turned to dust...
Whoops!
Attempt to flee.
I have been revealed! Someone overheard me discussing my Cult with another, and has revealed my secret to the Court!
A ferocious pack of wolves appear on the road before you.
What do I care?

The Red Ring Road, an ancient route circumnavigating Lake Rumare and the Imperial Isle has been restored by [From.GetTitledFirstName]. The restoration of this roadway has increased trade significantly in the region, and the local Lords and citizens look forwards to a new era of prosperity.
Red Ring Restored!
Siege Mines!

Using the skills learned from my architectural studies, I devised an elaborate plan of tunnelling beneath the walls of our target. I set the men to work immediately and within only a few short days, we were ready to ignite the mine.
Kwama Colony
This province is home to several Kwama Colonies.
Kwama Infestation
This province is infested with Kwama!
Hire some miners to tame the Kwama and harvest their eggs.

Upon learning about your new landed title, you left the Fighters' Guild and departed for home on a carriage filled with gold from your glorious accomplishments. It was a long and perilous journey back, but your feet are now firmly planted on the soil of the land that is your birthright. The title is yours.
It's good to be back home.

Upon learning about your new landed title, you left the Thieves' Guild and departed for home on a carriage filled with gold from your glorious accomplishments. It was a long and perilous journey back, but your feet are now firmly planted on the soil of the land that is your birthright. The title is yours.
It's good to be back home.
Leader
Spending time rallying soldiers, training them, arming them and sharing their life has given me new insight into how to lead men, and I feel I am a better leader for it.
Leads from the Fore
This person prefers to lead from the front, always at the head of their men.
Leads from the Rear
This person prefers to lead from the rear, preferring an overview of the entire battlefield to placing themselves in harms way.

Fell apart from Brown Rot
Brown rot is a disease affecting the victim's strength and behaviour. Symptoms include severe necrosis and sleeplessness.

Our countrymen suffer under the yoke of a terrible ruler, it is our duty to liberate them!
Liberate Slaves
Liberator
A crusader for the rights of Slaves, who seeks to free all those held in serval-bondage!

While studying the map I had commissioned by candlelight one night, I discovered one of the borders of my realm extends over into a neighbouring province. This could be an error on the cartographers part, or that land might really be mine!

Meritocracy
Aristocratic Leadership

Artistocratic Leadership means leadership of Armies and membership of the Council is determined by birth or chance, and appointments are for life. You have no choice in who leads your flanks or centre, and Nobles will refuse replacement. Although you can appoint whomever you wish to your Council, their appointment is generally for life.
Aristocracy
Meritocratic Leadership
Meritocratic Leadership allows you to appoint your own Generals, in theory based upon their skills rather than their birth. Meritocratic Leadership also allows free appointments to your Council.
Meritocracy
The Meritocracy Law allows you to appoint the most skilled Leaders to your centre and flanks.
Military Failure
Experimental theories in Military Training and Recruitment have proven to be disastrous, severely hindering advancement in the technological area.
Maruhk gives military advice.
column3: Jésus prodigue des conseils militaires.
column4: Maruhk gibt militärischen Rat.
column6: Jesús da consejo militar.

column2: Military Theories
My Liege! I have prepared a pamphlet upon military theories uncovered in my works and I am preparing to distribute it amongst the local officers.

While studying old warbooks and academic treatise on military tactics, training and recruitment, I had an epiphany. Quickly writing down my ideas, I compiled a pamphlet on military theory and prepared to distribute it.
It's definitely mine! All mine!

Unfortunately I have determined the province to which my liege has dispatched me is mineral poor, lacking in even base metals. My mission here will not yield anything worth mining, though agricultural discoveries may yet lie unnoticed.

Unfortunately I have determined that the province to which you have sent me to survey is Mineral Poor, lacking in even base metals. My mission here will not yield anything worth mining, though agricultural discoveries may yet lie unnoticed.
Mineral Poor Discovered
Mineral Poor
This province is lacking in almost all basic mineral resources, making for a very poor mining site.
Minor Title Autoassign

Minor Titles with tied modifiers and events will be auto-assigned to appropriate Courtiers or Vassals when possible. Titles such as Cupbearer, Court Jester which have no modifiers will *NOT* be Auto assigned. (This is an OPTIONAL decisions, you do not HAVE to use it, it is purely here to make things easier for you, Minor Titles can still be manually assigned with this decision activated)
Disable Autoassign

I am preparing myself for my travel to High Hrothgar, and I have understood that there are members of my court that have not yet gone on a pilgrimage to High Hrothgar. As [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], it is my duty to be charitable to my people, and I will bring one of them with me.
column3: Je me prépare à effectuer mon voyage jusqu'à La Mecque et j'ai entendu que de nombreux membres de ma cour ne sont jamais partis en pèlerinage à La Mecque. En tant que [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], je me dois d'être charitable envers mes gens, et j'ai décidé d'emmener l'un d'eux avec moi.
column4: Ich bereite mich auf meine Reise nach Mekka vor und habe festgestellt, dass es Mitglieder meines Hofes gibt, die bisher noch nicht auf eine Wallfahrt nach Mekka gegangen sind. Als [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] ist es meine Pflicht, barmherzig zu meinem Volk zu sein, und werde einen von ihnen mit mir nehmen.
column6: Me estoy preparando para mi viaje a La Meca, y he comprendido que hay miembros de mi corte que todavía no han hecho la peregrinación a La Meca. Como [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], es mi deber ser generoso con mi gente y llevaré a uno de ellos conmigo.

column2: While preparing for my pilgrimage to High Hrothgar, I have come to realize that [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] has not undertaken the Greybeard Pilgrimage.
column3: Alors que je me préparais pour mon voyage vers La Mecque, je me suis rendu compte que [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] n'avait jamais fait le Pilgrimage.
column4: Während meiner Vorbereitungen der Wallfahrt nach Mekka wurde mir klar, dass [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] kein Wallfahrer nach Mekka ist.
column6: Mientras me preparo para mi peregrinación a La Meca, me he dado cuenta de que [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] no es un Pilgrim.

column2: Dear [Root.GetTitledFirstName]!\nI will join you on your way to High Hrothgar!\nYour liege, [From.GetTitledName]
column3: Cher [Root.GetTitledFirstName] !\nJ'accepte de faire ce voyage à La Mecque avec vous !\nVotre vassal, [From.GetTitledName]
column4: [Root.GetTitledFirstName]!\nIch werde mich Euch auf Eurem Weg nach Mekka anschließen!\nEuer Lehnsherr, [From.GetTitledName]
column6: Querido [Root.Liege.GetTitledName]\nTe acompañaré en tu  camino a La Meca\nTu Señor, [From.GetTitledName]

column2: My beloved [Root.GetTitle]!\n I am preparing to go to High Hrothgar on a Pilgrimage. Sadly, rumours tell me that you have not gone on a pilgrimage yourself. Would you like to travel with me, your faithful servant?\nYour humble [From.GetTitledName]
column3: Mon cher [Root.GetTitle] !\nJe me prépare à partir pour La Mecque pour mon grand pèlerinage. Malheureusement, des rumeurs disent que vous-même ne vous y êtes jamais rendu? Aimeriez-vous m'accompagner en tant que fidèle serviteur ?\nVotre humble [From.GetTitledName]
column4: Mein geliebter [Root.GetTitle]!\n Ich bereite mich darauf vor auf einen Hadsch nach Mekka zu gehen. Leider ist mir Gerüchte zu Ohren gekommen, dass Ihr selbst bisher noch nicht an einer Wallfahrt teilgenommen habt. Möchtet Ihr mit mir reisen, Eurem getreuen Diener?\nEuer demütiger [From.GetTitledName]
column6: Mi querido [Root.GetTitle]\n Me estoy preparando para ir a La Meca en la Pilgrimage. Lamentablemente,  los rumores dicen que tú no has ido a hacer la peregrinación. ¿Te gustaría viajar conmigo, tu fiel sirviente? \nSu humilde [From.GetTitledName]

column2: I am sincerely regretful to inform you that I am not able to join you in your pilgrimage.\n[From.GetTitledName]
column3: Je suis au regret de vous informer que je ne pourrai me joindre à vous pour ce pèlerinage.\n[From.GetTitledName]
column4: Ich bedaure es zutiefst, Euch mitteilen zu müssen, dass ich Euch auf Eurer Wallfahrt nicht begleiten kann.\n[From.GetTitledName]
column6: Me apena mucho tener que decirte que no podré unirme a tu peregrinación.\n[From.GetTitledName]

column2: While preparing for my pilgrimage to High Hrothgar, my son comes to me and asks if he can join me.
column3: Alors que je me préparais pour mon pèlerinage pour La Mecque, mon fils est venu me demander s'il pouvait m'accompagner.
column4: Während meiner Vorbereitungen der Wallfahrt nach Mekk, kommt mein Sohn auf mich zu und bittet darum, sich mir anschließen zu dürfen.
column6: Mientras me preparaba para la peregrinación a La Meca, mi hijo se acerca y pregunta si puede unirse al viaje.

column2: Our liege, [Root.Liege.GetTitledName], has heard of our plans to go to High Hrothgar, and sends us advice that the steps are perilous with beasts and bandits.
column3: Notre seigneur, [Root.Liege.GetTitledName], a entendu parler de notre projet d'aller à La Mecque et nous informe que la route est dangereuse, et jonchée de bandits et d'infidèles.
column4: Unser Fürst, [Root.Liege.GetTitledName], hat von Euren Plänen gehört, nach Mekka zu gehen, und entsendet uns den Rat, dass die Straße durch Banditen und Ungläubige gefährlich ist.
column6: Nuestro señor, [Root.Liege.GetTitledName], ha escuchado nuestros planes de ir a La Meca, y nos advierte que el camino está infestado de infieles y bandidos.

column2: You have started to prepare yourself for going on a pilgrimage to High Hrothgar. Soon you will humble yourself and travel in a group with others to fulfill the Greybeard Pilgrimage.
column3: Vous vous préparez à partir en pèlerinage à la Mecque. Très vite, vous ferez preuve d'humilité et voyagerez en groupe avec d'autres compagnons pour réaliser l'un des cinq piliers de l'Islam.
column4: Ihr habt Euch auf eine Wallfahrt nach Mekka vorbereitet. Bald werdet Ihr Euch erniedrigen und mit anderen in einer Gruppe reisen, um einen Pfeiler des Islams zu erfüllen.
column6: Has comenzado a prepararte para ir de peregrinación a La Meca. Pronto mostrarás humildad y viajarás con otros para completar uno de los cinco pilares del islam.

Pacifist Sentiment
The populace of this province have adopted a pacifistic sentiment as of late, and fewer men answer the call to our banner.
Rulers are allowed to subjugate other rulers whitin a kingdom with the 'Become King' ambition. Free men are always willing to follow the mightiest ruler...
column3: Les païens peuvent assujettir d'autres païens, ce, une seule fois pendant toute leur vie. (Avec l'ambition Devenir roi, cette limitation est levée quand il s'agit de cibles à l'intérieur du royaume visé.) Les hommes libres veulent toujours suivre le souverain le plus puissant...
column4: Heiden dürfen einmal im Leben andere heidnische Anfährer unterwerfen. (Mit der 'König werden'-Ambition gibt es kein solches Zeitlimit gegen Gegner innerhalb des Königreiches.) Freie Männer sind immer willens, dem stärksten Herrscher zu folgen...
column6: Los paganos pueden subyugar a otros gobernantes paganos durante su vida. (Con la ambición 'Convertirse en Rey' no hay existe un plazo contra los objetivos dentro de los territorios de ese Reino.) Los hombres libres siempre estarán dispuestos a seguir al gobernante más poderoso...

column2: Popular Sentiment
This populace of this province support their local liege and flock to his banners in his support.
Population Fearful

Rumours of dark creatures lurking in the night have set the population of this province ill-at-ease. The people are fearful and angry at their liege lord's lack of action, and the local economy has been hampered as a result.
The painter will work on your own portrait.

The portrait you had commissioned of your honoured father is finally unveiled. It depicts your father stood tall and stoic amongst the chaos of a battle scene. His eyes gaze out of the picture, as if calling you to join him in the battle, to uphold the honour of your house.

The portrait you had commissioned of your honoured father is finally unveiled. It depicts a scene now burned into your memory of your father standing tall against his foe in the duel that took his life, though the opponent's face is shadowed and unrecognisable.

The portrait you had commissioned of your honoured father is finally unveiled, a shockingly realistic depiction of your father in his prime, sword at his waist and a tabard draped across his chest emblazoned with your family arms.

The portrait you had commissioned of your dear mother is finally unveiled. It depicts your mother stood tall and stoic amongst the chaos of a battle scene. Her eyes gaze out of the picture, as if calling you to join her in battle, to uphold the honour of your house.

The portrait you had commissioned of your dear mother is finally unveiled. It depicts a scene now burned into your memory of your mother standing tall against her foe in the duel that took her life, though the opponent's face is shadowed and unrecognisable.
The portrait you had commissioned of your dear mother is finally unveiled, a shockingly realistic depiction of your mother in her prime, a drapery in the hinterground emblazoned with her family arms.

The painter finally unveils the portrait you had commissioned of yourself. Gasps rise from the crowd as the court artist unveils an obviously embellished and idealised depiction of your visage. A half-hearted clap rises from the gathered audience, and you smile broadly, patting the artist on the back.

The Painter finally unveils the portrait you had commissioned of yourself. Gasps rise from the crowd as the court artist unveils an almost lifelike depiction of your form upon canvas, the eyes gazing out and almost following you around the room. Claps rise around the room, and you smile proudly at the portrait, patting the artist on the back.

The Painter finally unveils the portrait you had commissioned of yourself. Gasps rise from the crowd as the court artist unveils a shockingly realistic depiction of your visage, in all its ugly splendour. You nod grimly, then a smile crosses your face.  No one will forget this portrait after you've passed.

The painter finally unveils the portrait you had commissioned of yourself. Gasps rise from the crowd as the court artist unveils the nude work you had him create, albeit with a little embellishment...
The painter begins their work!

[Root.GetName] is currently in the grips of a severe famine, food is scarce and even the nobles are tightening their belts. The coin in our treasury could be used to alleviate the situation by purchasing supplies and rations for the afflicted area.
Adventurers in [Root.GetName] have caused an almost near extinction of the local Goblin tribes to the point of the Goblins no longer posing any more than a nuisance threat to the local population.
Adventurers in [Root.GetName] have eliminated the local Skeever infestation.

Adventurers in [Root.GetName] have eliminated the local Falmer infestation.

A group of normally docile Giants have become a problem in [Root.GetName]. Their numbers have increased in size, and their normal hunter-gatherer and mammoth domestication methods are insufficient to feed their population, as a result they have begun attacking our outlying farms and harassing caravans passing along our main trade routes.
Giants!

Bandits!

Werewolves!
The undead are rising from their graves in [Root.GetName] and the local populace lives in abject terror of the night, when the undead seem most active.

column2: Restore High Rock
High Rock is the traditional name of the Direnni Dominion lands. We can restore the name of this old region with a simple royal edict!
Restore Direnni Hegemony
The Direnni Hegemony was an Altmer-ruled Kingdom that dominated a large part of High Rock and areas of Skyrim at its height. We can restore the name of this fabled Kingdom with a simple royal edict!

The formerly shadowy cult in [Root.GetName] has spiraled out of control! Its agents have clandestinely convinced the local populace to embrace its ways. Now, the cult's powers have truly waxed, and the people of [Root.GetName] have the audacity to publicly proclaim their new beliefs!
The cultists are revealed...\n
An artist of some renown has visited court seeking patronage for their works.
I've always enjoyed the arts.
What has art ever done for me? Begone you braggart!

A renowned tailor, hearing of my wealth, has visited court with a display of their finest works. They are knowledgeable about the latest fashions in the Imperial Isle, perhaps I should have them update my wardrobe?
Oh yes, most definitely. I hear velvet is in this season!
Extravagance has never been my style.

A collector of baubles and enchanted trinkets has gained an audience with you in your quieter moments. He regales you with tales of wonderous artifacts and high adventures, and offers to sell you one of his latest finds.
You purchase the collector's bauble.
It certainly looks extravagant and powerful!
What use do I have for trinkets? Out of my sight, peddler of cheap merchandise!

The item I purchased from the collector turned out to be nothing more than a piece of junk. The so-called gemstones mounted upon it are nothing but bits of some kind of resin, and the gold is just painted upon a surface of simple wrought iron.

The item I purchased from the collector turned out to be nothing more than a piece of junk. Still, one of my vassals was enamoured with it when they visited court, calling it a work of art. I gave it to them as a gift, and they loved me for it.

The High Kingdom of Skyrim

Today, I [Root.GetFirstName] have reunited the High Kingdom of Skyrim. My power in the frozen north is almost unmatched, and now is the time I send forth my envoys to the realm, and demand the submission of those that would call themselves my equals.
Dispatch the Envoys.
I am without equals, Skyrim belongs to me!

As a holder of land or title within the territory of Skyrim, we have received word of the crowning of a new High King or Queen. Other Petty Kings and rulers have acquiesced to this High King's demands of subservience, and while our stature affords us no responsibility to entertain the idea, there is a chance this ruler will look to claiming the title they believe rightly belongs to them.
I am prepared to defend my titles!
As the ruler of the High Kingdom of Skyrim, it is not fitting that I should hold the titles of the petty realms there within.
Of course.

As the ruler of Eastmarch it is my right to claim the title of King. Though I will be a King in name only, the status will bring me and my dynasty greater prestige, and should the time come where I must break free of the High Kingdom, the ancient lands of Eastmarch will be mine to claim.
Send an Envoy to the High Kingdom!
Petty Kingdom of Eastmarch

An envoy has approached us from our vassal in Eastmarch. [From.GetFirstName] has requested we confer upon them the status of Petty King of Eastmarch. This will grant them extra prestige and standing amongst our vassals, but as long as they remain our vassal it will not confer any additional temporal powers.
Grant the Kingdom, by rights it is theirs.
There will be no Kingdom of Eastmarch, petty or otherwise!
My liege, [From.GetTitledFirstName][From.GetFirstName] has conferred upon me the title King of Eastmarch!
Excellent!
My liege has refused my request to be named the King of Eastmarch.
One day the Kingdom will be mine!

Skyrim Dissolves

The rulers of Skyrim no longer stand united, they no longer recognise the authority of the High Kingdom and it has become nothing but a shadow of its former glory. Without the support of the realm, the Kingdom can no longer stand, and on this black day the banners are torn down and the High Kingdom stands no more.

As the ruler of Winterhold it is my right to claim the title of King. Though I will be a King in name only, the status will bring me and my dynasty greater prestige, and should the time come where I must break free of the High Kingdom, the ancient lands of Winterhold will be mine to claim.
Send an Envoy to the High Kingdom!
Petty Kingdom of Winterhold

An envoy has approached us from our vassal in Winterhold. [From.GetFirstName] has requested we confer upon them the status of Petty King of Winterhold. This will grant them extra prestige and standing amongst our vassals, but as long as they remain our vassal it will not confer any additional temporal powers.
Grant the Kingdom, by rights it is theirs.
There will be no Kingdom of Winterhold, petty or otherwise!
My liege, [From.GetTitledFirstName][From.GetFirstName] has conferred upon me the title King of Winterhold!
Excellent!
My liege has refused my request to be named the King of Winterhold.
One day the Kingdom will be mine!
Slandered
Rumours have been spread about [Root.GetBestName], tarnishing their reputation.
Slandered
Rumours have been spread about [Root.GetBestName], tarnishing their reputation.
Slandered
Rumours have been spread about [Root.GetBestName], tarnishing their reputation.
Slandered Spouse

Your Prison Warden comes in the night, binding you in chains and throwing you out of your cell, into a pack of other prisoners. You can see at the entrance to the dungeon a fat merchant passing a heavy pouch of coin to your imprisoner. You have been sold into a life of slavery, your part in Nirn's history ends here...
Slaver
Slavery is legal within our realm and this province is populous enough. Why don't we take a few prisoners along with our loot and sell them in our markets?
[From.Location.GetName] has been raided by slavers!
A few coins for a few corpses, sounds like a deal to me!
I have no need of slaves, they cause nothing but trouble.
Slavery is an abomination! I would never partake in such a practice!
The Slave Rebellion gripping our realm has attracted flocks of ungrateful slaves and disgruntled peasants to its banner!
The realm to which my lands are beholden has enacted the laws of slavery, allowing sentient beings to be sold as if they were property. I find this act abhorrent, perhaps I should do something about?
Slavery Outlawed

Slavery is illegal within the realm, and all slaves are immediately freed from bondage. (Slavery is so entwined with Ayleid, Dunmer and Kamal culture that attempting to illegalise it is impossible for these people)
Outlawed
Slavery Allowed

Slavery is legal within the realm, people may be bought and sold by happenstance of birth, indebtedness, or as spoils of war. (Nedic, Khajiit and Tang Mo Pantheon religions are unable to Legalise Slavery due to long standing cultural and religious moors against enslaving sentient beings)
Allowed
§Y*§! Allows the enslavement of a province by §Yraiding it§!.\n§Y*§! Unlocks the §YSlave Raid§! Casus Belli, allowing the slaver to enslave all provinces bordering the target realm.
Slavery

Slavery was often a contentious issue in Tamriel, originally eradicated from Cyrodiil and most of the continent by the Alessian Order, however certain cultures still practice Slavery or a form of indentured servitude...
[Root.GetBestName] thinks nothing of taking other sentient races and putting them in binds, to serve as hard labour or household slaves.
Slaves
The defeated soldiers, and the citizens that cowered inside the holding as your forces besieged it have surrendered. Many of them are able bodied, and could sell well in the slave markets.
I do not care for this slave trade.
Sell them, I could use a few coins.
This province has a sizeable population of slaves, taken in a raid on another province.
Slave Raid
This province has been raided by slavers. They have ransacked the place and taken hostages to be sold in markets as property.
Slave Revolt
Slave Trade
This province is home to a large slave market, a result of the healthy slave trade taking place in the realm.
Yellow Fever
The endurance, willpower, and health of a victim of Yellow Fever will decline each day, until they find a cure or die.
Blacksmith
[Root.GetFirstName] feels most at home in the smoky atmosphere of a blacksmiths, working metal with hammer upon anvil into wondrous artifacts.
Disable UESP Links

column4: UESP-Links deaktivieren
column6: Desactivar enlaces a UESP

column2: Armour of Snake
Robe of Snake
Sword of Snake
Snake Tongue
So, my liege already knew and did not tell me!?
You count your new coin as your former prisoner is led away in chains to their new fate as a slave.
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] is sold in to Slavery.
Slave
Sold in to Slavery
[Root.GetFirstName] was sold in to slavery. Their part in Nirnian history has ended.
Solitude stands independent again, ready to face the world under its own banner, with me as its [Root.GetTitledFirstName]!
For Solitude!
For many years now the Kingdom of Solitude has kept its independence and none now dispute our right to claim our ancient lands as our own.
These lands shall always be Solitude's!

Several former Fighter's Guildsmen have recently returned home after being discharged from service, and they bring news most grave. Your child, [From.GetTitledFirstName], was killed by a group of bandits during an extremely dangerous mission in southern Hammerfell. They assure you that [From.GetSheHe] faced the bandits with bravery and tried [From.GetHerHis] best before [From.GetSheHe] was killed by their overwhelming number.
My kid died a hero...

Excentric figures lurk from the shadows, they hand out a letter to a guard and leave, nowhere to be seen. The letter brings news most grave. Your child, [From.GetTitledFirstName], was killed during a heist of some sort. Soon after you read it, the ink from the letter magickally disappears.
What my kid got involved into?

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned from the Fighter's Guild as a changed being. [From.GetSheHe] is more ambitious and more knowledgeable in matters of war. It seems the time spent in the Fighter's Guild did [From.GetHerHim] good.
Did you bring any gold home with you?

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned from his so-called adventuring period as a changed being. [From.GetSheHe] is more greedy and more experienced in matters of intrigue. It seems the time spent away did [From.GetHerHim] good.
Did you bring any gold home with you?

After many years in service, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has finally left the Fighter's Guild and returned home. Your child is a changed being, however. [From.GetSheHe] is prone to aggressive behavior and no longer listen to your fatherly advices.
I knew something bad was going to happen!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has finally returned home after a long and successful career in the Fighter's Guild! [From.GetSheHe] learned much from the experienced warriors and knights favoured by both the Nord and Orsimer warriors.
Tell me about your missions!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has finally returned home after a long and successful career in... Whatever thing he was doing while he was away! [From.GetSheHe] learned much from the experienced warriors and knights favoured by both the Nord and Orsimer warriors.
Tell me about... Whatever you're doing!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned from Cyrodiil and the Fighter's Guild, but [From.GetSheHe] refuses to speak of [From.GetHerHis] experiences there. You know [From.GetSheHe] took part in several battles and killed uncountable bandits, but instead of reveling in the glory of [From.GetHerHis] accomplishments, [From.GetFirstName] is plagued by nightmares and jumps at sudden sounds.
Strange...
column3: Étrange...
column4: Seltsam…
column6: Extraño…

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned from... That place he was in. But [From.GetSheHe] refuses to speak of [From.GetHerHis] experiences there. You know [From.GetSheHe] took part in odd business. [From.GetFirstName] is plagued by nightmares and jumps at sudden sounds.
Strange...
column3: Étrange...
column4: Seltsam…
column6: Extraño…

column2: A mysterious warrior clad in strange armour approaches your throne, and before [From.GetSheHe] can be contained, the stranger relieves your guard of [From.GetHerHis] spear in a swift, fluid motion and tosses it aside. Other guards hurry forward, but you raise your hand to stop them. The stranger is [From.GetTitledFirstName], at last returned from the Fighter's Guild!
[From.GetFirstName]! You've... changed!

A mysterious rogue clad in strange clothes approaches your throne, and before [From.GetSheHe] can be contained, the stranger relieves your guard of [From.GetHerHis] spear in a swift, fluid motion and tosses it aside. Other guards hurry forward, but you raise your hand to stop them. The stranger is [From.GetTitledFirstName], at last returned!
[From.GetFirstName]! You've... changed!

Your child, [From.GetTitledFirstName], has finally returned home from the Fighter's Guild! Although you can't quite put your finger on it, [From.GetSheHe] seems different somehow... and what is this Brotherly love [From.GetSheHe] speaks of?
No matter, I'm just glad [From.GetSheHe] made it home!

Your child, [From.GetTitledFirstName], has finally returned home from... That place! Although you can't quite put your finger on it, [From.GetSheHe] seems different somehow... and what is this Brotherly love [From.GetSheHe] speaks of?
No matter, I'm just glad [From.GetSheHe] made it home!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has come home from the Fighter's Guild, but [From.GetSheHe] is not alone. [From.GetSheHe] has found an lowborn partner and brought [From.GetHerHim] with him. He is not familiar with our local customs, and the climate does not seem to agree with him, but he seems willing to make the best of [From.GetHerHis] new home.
To each [From.GetHerHis] own

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has come home from... [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap] knows where. But [From.GetSheHe] is not alone. [From.GetSheHe] has found an lowborn partner and brought [From.GetHerHim] with him. He is not familiar with our local customs, and the climate does not seem to agree with him, but he seems willing to make the best of his new home.
To each [From.GetHerHis] own

After some years away, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has finally returned home. Your child is a changed being, however. [From.GetSheHe] started to worship a strange, almost heretic, deity and no longer listen to your fatherly advices.
I knew something bad was going to happen!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has at last returned from the Fighter's Guild on a carriage filled with the spoils of [From.GetHerHis] quests! Apparently going on adventures is very profitable business. Your child insists on sharing these riches with you, [From.GetHerHis] loving father.
[From.GetFirstName], you make me proud!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has at last returned from... Somewhere... On a carriage filled with the spoils of [From.GetHerHis] conquests! Apparently going on adventures is very profitable business. Your child insists on sharing these riches with you, [From.GetHerHis] loving father.
[From.GetFirstName], you make me both proud and rich!

A frail, robed person is led into your throne room, and your guards explain that [From.GetSheHe] just arrived on a carriage. The person would only speak your name over and over again, and so [From.GetSheHe] was brought to you. To your horror, you recognise [From.GetHerHim] at last as [From.GetTitledFirstName]!
What have they done to you!?

A frail, robed person is led into your throne room, and your guards explain that [From.GetSheHe] just arrived on a carriage. The person would only speak your name over and over again, and so [From.GetSheHe] was brought to you. To your horror, you recognise [From.GetHerHim] at last as [From.GetTitledFirstName]!
What have they done to you!?

Your child, [From.GetTitledFirstName], has decided to join the local chapter of the Fighter's Guild and seek [From.GetHerHis] fortune there! Although [From.GetSheHe] will no doubt gain both riches and valuable battle experience with [From.GetHerHis] shield-brothers, there will be many dangerous quests that could well cost [From.GetHerHis] life.
Join the Fighter's Guild and make me proud child!
I will not allow it!

Your child, [From.GetTitledFirstName], has decided to steer away from the court and seek [From.GetHerHis] own fortune! Although [From.GetSheHe] will no doubt gain both riches and valuable experience with in his adventure. There, whenever the place he wants to go is, will be many dangerous stuff that could well cost [From.GetHerHis] life.
Go and make me proud child!
I will not allow it!
Soulless

[Root.GetFirstName] has a glazed over look to their eyes and speaks in a monotone voice. Their soul has been stripped from their body, granting immortality at the price of imagination, creativity, wonder and love.
So be it.
Sparse Population
The population in this province is extremely low, much of the farmland lays untended and the settlements are sparsely inhabited.
Stalwart Defender
State Inquisitor
Favour

Favour is respected by the clergy of your faith, and is added to your score upon the death of your character. It represents a positive relationship with your patron God, Gods or your general acceptance of your faith and in certain religions, such as the Daedric Cults a positive Favour can lead to great boons.

Favour is respected by the clergy of your faith, and is added to your score upon the death of your character. It represents a positive relationship with your patron God, Gods or your general acceptance of your faith and in certain religions, such as the Daedric Cults a positive Favour can lead to great boons.
Favour

column2: Stendarr grant our enemies mercy for we have none to spare!
Captured Banner
Stomach Rot
of Stomach Rot
Stomach Rot is a permanent condition, unless cured, characterized by a slight daily drop in health.
Stone Deposits
An abundance of stone usable for cutting and construction is easily accessible in several sites in this province.
Jarl
My Most Noble Jarl
of severe stress
Stunning!
Rule by Might

Your most powerful child will inherit, though other powerful children are likely to interfere. The inheritor may also face challenges to their rule from powerful vassals, should they show any signs of weakness.
The High Kingdom of Summerset

Today, I [Root.GetFirstName] have united the High Kingdom of Summerset. My power in these Isles is almost unmatched, and now is the time I should send forth my envoys to the realm, and demand the submission of those that would call themselves my equals.
I am without equals, Summerset belongs to me!

As a holder of land or title within the territory of Summerset, we have received word of the crowning of a new High King or Queen. Other Petty Kings and rulers have acquiesced to this High King's demands of subservience, and while our stature affords us no responsibility to entertain the idea, there is a chance this ruler will look to claiming the title they believe rightly belongs to them.

[From.GetFirstName] has sent forth envoys, proclaiming the formation of the High Kingdom of Summerset. As a King within the lands [From.GetFirstName] claims, [From.GetSheHe] has demanded my submission.
Alinor Refuses
My envoy has returned from Alinor, and the [From.GetTitledFirstName] has refused to submit to the High Kingdom of Summerset.
Lillandril Refuses
My envoy has returned from Lillandril, and the [From.GetTitledFirstName] has refused to submit to the High Kingdom of Summerset.
Auridon Refuses
My envoy has returned from Auridon, and the [From.GetTitledFirstName] has refused to submit to the High Kingdom of Summerset.
Shimmerene Refuses
My envoy has returned from Shimmerene, and the [From.GetTitledFirstName] has refused to submit to the High Kingdom of Summerset.
Summerset will claim their lands in time.
Alinor Declares War!
My envoy has returned from Alinor, the [From.GetTitledFirstName] has refused to submit, and has gone a step further. My envoy informs me they have declared war for the High Kingdom!
Lillandril Declares War!
My envoy has returned from Lillandril, the [From.GetTitledFirstName] has refused to submit, and has gone a step further. My envoy informs me they have declared war for the High Kingdom!
Auridon Declares War!
My envoy has returned from Auridon, the [From.GetTitledFirstName] has refused to submit, and has gone a step further. My envoy informs me they have declared war for the High Kingdom!
Shimmerene Declares War!
My envoy has returned from Shimmerene, the [From.GetTitledFirstName] has refused to submit, and has gone a step further. My envoy informs me they have declared war for the High Kingdom!
You pressed claim for the quest of making Kingdom of Sun to one of your de jure Kingdoms too soon, so you have to wait to press claims again.
Press Claims on Duchy Kalaqa
Press claims on Duchy Kalaqa and conquer it in order to make your way to create Kingdom of Sun.
Press Claims on Kingdom of Sun
Press claims on Kingdom of Sun and conquer it in order to make your way to add it to your de jure.
Add Kingdom of Sun to Ka Po' Tun Empire
Add Kingdom of Sun to Ka Po' Tun Empire de jure.
Press Claims on Duchy Ajalil
Press claims on Duchy Ajalil and conquer it in order to make your way to create Kingdom of Sun.
Press Claims on Duchy Kabam
Press claims on Duchy Kabam and conquer it in order to make your way to create Kingdom of Sun.
Press Claims on Kingdom of Sun
Press claims on Kingdom of Sun and conquer it in order to make your way to add it to your de jure.
Add Kingdom of Sun to Tsaesci Empire
Add Kingdom of Sun to Tsaesci Empire de jure.
Press Claims on Duchy Namilam
Press claims on Duchy Namilam and conquer it in order to make your way to create Kingdom of Sun.
Create a survey map so I may better administrate my realm.

The Cartographer rushes into your audience room after an absence of many months. Brushing aside the collected scrolls and manuscripts upon your desk, he lays a large rolled parchment upon the table, and proceeds to unravel it revealing an intricately drawn survey map of your realm, with detailed economic information for each settlement, including mines, large farms and estates, mineral deposits and forests of each region.
Commissioned Survey Map
Suspected Daedra Spawn

column2: Swamp Rot
Victims of Swamp Rot will have their willpower, agility, and strength fall daily, until they waste away or are cured.
Swordmaster
My liege has dispatched me to deal with criminals in his realm as I see fit.
I have successfully dealt with the criminal elements in one of my liege's provinces.
I have successfully dealt with the criminal elements in one of my liege's provinces, but I have been gravely wounded in my quest.
During my mission to end the criminal threat in my liege's demesne I was gravely wounded, and alas my quest has failed as a result.
During my quest to end the criminal threat within my liege's realm I was overcome by the enemy and brutally murdered.
Your Swordmaster reports a successful completion of their quest against the Smugglers' Ring in one of your provinces.
Your Swordmaster reports a successful completion of their quest against the Thieves' Guild in one of your provinces.
Your Swordmaster reports a successful completion of their quest against a large group of bandits in one of your provinces.
Your Swordmaster reports a successful completion of their quest against a group of highwaymen in one of your provinces.
Your Swordmaster has been injured while attempting to deal with criminal elements in your demesne.  As a result their quest has failed.
Your Swordmaster has been murdered while attempting to deal with criminal elements in your demesne.  As a result their quest has failed.
Appointed Swordmaster
Appointed Swordmaster
Deal with Criminals (Swordmaster)
Dispatch your Swordmaster to deal with bandits, thieves, smugglers or highwaymen in your provinces.
(Rebellion) Dispatch Swordmaster
Dispatch the Swordmaster to deal with a rebellion in one of your provinces.

My Swordmaster, an individual skilled in singular battle but also versed in the arts of war, is well suited to deal with a peasant rebellion afflicting one of my provinces, but where should I send them?
Gonorrhoea
of Gonorrhoea
[Root.GetFirstName] suffers from the painful venereal plague known as gonorrhoea.
Magickal Training
Improved battle magick, recruitment and training for battlemages.
Magickal Infrastructure
Improved construction techniques, equipment and enchantments for the study of spells, reagents and potions within proper environments.
The Magical Arts
The advancement of wizardy and the arcane arts.
Populism
Improved relations with the ignoble populace.
Elitism
Improved relations with our noble and upper strata populace.
Academy Infrastructure
Improved buildings for Academy holdings.
Continue.
of a poor diet

The Ebonheart Pact is a mutual alliance of defence, a bonding of realms under a single banner to defend their lands and their people from the predations of other realms, and to restore order to a chaotic world.

The Daggerfall Covenant is a mutual alliance of defence, a bonding of realms under a single banner in a pact, a covenant, to defend their lands and their people from the predations of other realms, and to restore order to a chaotic world.
That's nice...
The Reach stands independent again, ready to face the world under its own banner, with me as its [Root.GetTitledFirstName]!
For the Reach!
For many years now the Kingdom of the Reach has kept its independence and none now dispute our right to claim our ancient lands as our own.
These lands shall always be the Reach's!
The Rift stands independent again, ready to face the world under its own banner, with me as its [Root.GetTitledFirstName]!
For the Rift!
For many years now the Kingdom of the Rift has kept its independence and none now dispute our right to claim our ancient lands as our own.
These lands shall always be the Rifts!
The time is not yet right.
As a Thief, you have the opportunity to attempt to steal the item, potentially gaining it for free!
Whoops! I begged for forgiveness as soon as it happened!
Actually, that was fun! I might do it again...
While learning Fus Ro Dah, I accidentally shouted someone off the mountain.
Way of the Voice
I must remember to say thanks!
You have successfully learned Thu'um!
Oof. How embarrassing!
You have failed to learn Thu'um!
I've changed my mind, I don't want to go!
Before I left for Hrothgar, I attempted to procure provisions and adequate supplies for the journey. Unfortunately, the supplies came with a hefty price tag.
I must be bear the costs of this journey, the reward at the end will be worth it!
My liege has decided to make a pilgrimage to High Hrothgar, effectively leaving the realm in the hands of a Regent while he cavorts around the mountains of Skyrim.
What do I care?
I must have words with my liege and convince him to remain, for the stability of the realm!
Perhaps this occasion will work to my benefit...
A vassal is unhappy at my decision to travel to High Hrothgar to learn the ancient way of the voice. They feel I am abandoning my realm to the wolves to satisfy my own whims.
I will approach them diplomatically and explain my reasons for going.
I am their Liege and I will do as I damn well please!
Perhaps they are right, this pilgrimage was a poor decision.
My liege has refused to listen to my pleas and is determined to traverse the snowy wastes of Skyrim to reach his goal of learning the way of thu'um.
My liege is a fool.
My liege invited me to a private discussion, and explained his reasons for wishing to undertake this pilgrimage. I have but little choice to accept my liege's decision.
The arguments were very persuasive!
My liege has accepted my arguments as to the foolishness of their decision to make a pilgrimage to High Hrothgar.
Excellent!

My only heir has declared their intent to make a pilgrimage to High Hrothgar to learn the way of Thu'um. The journey could be perilous, and there is a chance my line may die with them should some horror claim their life.
What do I care? Their life is their own.
They cannot go! I forbid it!
My parents have forbidden me from undertaking my pilgrimage.
They are my parents, I must therefore accept their decision.
Who cares? It's my life!
I must convince them why I should go!
My child has refused to listen and will shortly set off on their dangerous pilgrimage, against my authority!
How dare they!

My child has discussed the matter of Hrothgar with me, and offered some pretty convincing arguments. I have allowed them leave to undertake this journey, though seeing my heir leaving will not sit easy in my thoughts.
I'm sure nothing will happen...right?
Learn Thu'um Dragonshouts
To undertake this journey, you must be of age and sound health!
I was careless!
I was pathetic!
I was unlucky!
I was cursed!
I was terrible!

By [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] no longer has enough kingdoms to be considered an empire! You have now been stripped of your $CHARACTERTITLE$ title, and the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] is no longer recognised.
Archduke of Dres
The leader of Great House Dres.
Archmagister of Telvanni
The leader of Great House Telvanni.
Archmaster of Redoran
The leader of Great House Redoran.
Court Battlemage
The Court Battlemage is an exclusive title for individuals skilled in both the arcane and the art of war.
Champion of Cyrodiil

The highest level one could achieve in the Order of the Dragon, and considered as such the highest honour the Emperor could bestow upon an individual. Only those who have performed a great deed for the Empire may be bestowed with this honour.
Chief Architect
column3: Architecte en chef
column4: Chef-Architekt
column6: Arquitecto Jefe

column2: The Chief Architect is responsible for designing and overseeing the construction of palaces and grand monuments.
column3: L'architecte en chef est chargé de la création et de la surveillance de la construction des palais, mosquées et autres grands monuments.
column4: Der Chef-Architekt ist für die Planung und Beaufsichtigung beim Bau von Palästen, Moscheen und großen Denkmälern verantwortlich.
column6: El Arquitecto Jefe es responsable de diseñar y supervisar la construcción de palacios, mezquitas y grandes monumentos.

column2: Chief Qadi
column3: Cadi
column4: Ober-Kadi
column6: Cadí Jefe

column2: The Chief Qadi is the supreme judge and authority of the Law in the realm.
Lord Justice
The Lord Justice is responsible for enforcing his or her liege's law upon the populace, and serves as the chief administrator of the realm's courts and highest office of appeal.
Darkhan is a prestigious title amongst the Ashlanders bestowed by their rulers upon loyal and steadfast supporters.

The Cherbi is the leader of the imperial guard of the Ashlander Gahkhanate, the Chap'thil. They are charged with the protection of the empire's most important nobility, and the position as their commander is a very prestigious one.

This honorific, which means hero or valiant warrior, is an honorific that brings great respect amongst the Kamal. It is usually granted only to those who have truly distinguished themselves in battle as fierce warriors or shamans.

Amongst the witchmen of the Reach the Eagle holds a special place in their quasi-shamanistic-daedric religion, being a symbol and pseudonym of one of their greatest cultural heroes. Each Reachman Lord tends to maintain their own rookery of Eagles and lesser birds of prey for use in hunts and as symbols of status, the Master of the Eagle is the courtier appointed to oversee this Rookery and as such is a position of special significance to the Reachmen.
Personal Assassin
The personal assassin of a low--ranking noble.
Courtesan
Originally simply a courtier, this term can come to mean the sexual partner of a noble or other wealthy client, to whom the client is not married
Court Painter
column3: Calligraphe
column4: Hofkalligraph
column6: Calígrafo de la corte

column2: The Court Painter is generally a highly skilled artist given patronage by the Lord to paint various portraits of themselves, their family and respected members of the Court as well as other artly duties such as the creation of maps, frescos and other decorative paintings.
column3: L'art figuratif étant perçu comme une transgression par l'Islam, les calligraphes expérimentés sont hautement respectés.
column4: Der islamische Verdacht der metaphorischen Kunst verschafft erfahrenen Kalligraphen hohes Ansehen.
column6: La sospecha islámica del arte figurativo hace que los calígrafos expertos gocen de gran respeto.

column2: Court Musician
column3: Musicien
column4: Hofmusiker
column6: Músico de la corte

column2: The Court Musician is always ready to entertain with soothing or stirring music.
column3: Le musicien est toujours prêt à divertir la cour avec ses mélodies parfois apaisantes, parfois entraînantes.
column4: Der Hofmusiker ist immer bereit, mit sanfter oder ergreifender Musik zu unterhalten.
column6: El músico de la corte siempre está listo para entretener con música relajante o conmovedora.

column2: Court Painter
A court painter was an artist who painted for the members of a royal or noble family, sometimes on a fixed salary and on an exclusive basis where the artist was not supposed to undertake other work.
Court Poet
column3: Poète
column4: Hofdichter
column6: Poeta de la corte

column2: Poets enjoy a great deal of respect and prestige, but sometimes pushing the limits of what is acceptable under social morals.
column3: Les poètes islamiques jouissent d'un fort respect et d'un grand prestige. Traitant souvent du thème de la religion, il leur arrive parfois de repousser les limites de ce que l'Islam perçoit comme acceptable.
column4: Islamische Dichter erlangen großen Ruhm und Ansehen, oft religiöser Natur, aber machmal gehen sie über die Grenzen des im Islam Erlaubten hinaus.
column6: Los poetas islámicos disfrutan de gran respeto y prestigio, a menudo religiosos, pero a veces rozan los límites de lo aceptable para el Islam.

column2: Court Scribe

The Court Scribe is a learned individual responsible for the courtly library. Their duties include the cataloguing of tomes, the preparation of documents and the transcribing of the court's daily activities and words of their liege.\n§MUNLOCKS THE FOLLOWING DECISIONS:§!\n- Roll of Artifacts.
Dreamer
The Dreamer is a title of prestige and influence inside both the Sixth House faith and Great House Dagoth. They are said to represent the will of Dagoth Ur himself.
House Assassin
The personal assassin of a high-ranking noble.
Elder Councillor
The Elder Councillor is the representative of his Province's interest in the Elder Council. It's a position of much power and prestige.
Elder Councillor

The Elder Council is the elite legislative body of the Empire, and any individual granted a seat upon it may vote upon important issues affecting the realm. Powerful landholders, Dukes and Kings are automatically granted a position upon the Council.

column2: Grandmaster of Hlaalu
The leader of Great House Hlaalu.
Grand Prince of Indoril
The leader of Great House Indoril.
High Councillor of Sadras
The leader of Great House Sadras.
High Chancellor

The High Chancellor of the Empire is the Head of the Small Council, the functionaries who handle the day-to-day affairs of the Empire and often the Elder Council, the secondary legislative and advisory body to the Empire.
The High Judge is the supreme justice of the Realm, who answers only to the Ruler in most legal matters.
Honours
The liege has seen fit to honour an individual's name, increasing their prestige and renown in Court.
House Brother
The House Brother is a title of average prestige inside the Great House's hierarchy
House Cousin
The House Cousin is a title of some prestige inside the Great House's hierarchy
House Father
The House Father is a title of great prestige inside the Great House's hierarchy
Master of Ceremonies
The Master of Ceremonies is an important position at Court, the individual appointed is responsible for handling all festivities and officiating at ceremonies of Court.
Mage Councillor
Master-at-Arms
The Master-at-Arms is a highly skilled martial individual who assists the realm's Marshal with the physical training and organisation of the realm's soldiery.

This office dates all the way back the Alessian Order, and in a era where a horse is a symbol of power, still very important. Although the Master of the Horse delegates the actual day to day running of the actual stables, much of the prestige of this office comes from the responsibility for the stud.
column3: Ce titre, qui remonte aux Romains, à l’époque où les chevaux symbolisaient le pouvoir, demeure très important. Bien que le maître de cavalerie délègue bon nombre de ses tâches d’écurie quotidiennes à des subalternes, le prestige de ce titre est lié aux grandes responsabilités qui lui incombent.
column4: Dieses Amt gab es schon in der römischen Republik. Auch jetzt, in einem Zeitalter, in dem Pferde für Macht stehen, ist es immer noch sehr wichtig. Obwohl sich der Stallmeister nicht um das Alltagsgeschäft der Stallleitung kümmert, ist dieses Amt recht prestigeträchtig. Dies liegt an seiner Verantwortung für die Hengste.
column6: La historia de este cargo se remonta a la República Romana, en una era en la que el caballo era un animal muy importante que simbolizaba poder. Aunque el maestro de cuadras realmente delega los quehaceres diarios de los establos, gran parte del prestigio de este cargo se debe a la responsabilidad de velar por la caballeriza.

column2: Order of the Dragon

The Order of the Dragon was founded in the third era by Tiber Septim to reward those who had performed valiant deeds for the Empire. It was an extremely illustrious Order that held a great deal of prestige.

column2: Potentate

During times when the Emperor is otherwise unavailable or incapacitated, the power of authority rests upon the shoulders of the second most powerful individual in the Empire, normally the High Chancellor although in some extreme cases the Chancellor may forgo this position in favour of another
Primarch of Veloth
The leader of Great House Veloth
